loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La Sra. Sabina está casada hace 13 años con el Sr. Segundo López, el matrimonio posee 5 hijos todos menores de edad.

 Doña Sabina comenzó a trabajar desde muy pequeña , a lo edad de 10 años mas o menos en la venta de frutas (bananas, manzanas, naranjas y otros), debido a que provenía de una familia muy humilde compuesta por varios hermanos.
 
Además de eso tuvo la oportunidad de comprar un local dentro del mercado municipal de Itá, y no dejó pasar esa oportunidad. Hoy día utiliza el mismo para poner a la venta las menudencias que compra de distintos carniceros de la zona. Comenta que le va muy bien y que ya ha formado muy buena clientela.

Ella está muy orgullosa de si misma por que hasta el día de hoy sigue manteniendo su local de ventas y gracias a eso puede hacer posible que sus hijos puedan estudiar, ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar sus estudios debido a su mala situación económica.

En esta oportunidad solicita el crédito para la compra de menudencias debido a que tiene mucha demanda de sus mercaderías.
texts.en:
Sabina has been married for 13 years to Mr. Segundo López and they have five young children. Sabina started working when she was very young and at more or less 10 years of age sold fruit (bananas, apples, oranges and others) since she came from a humble family composed of various siblings. Besides this she had the opportunity to buy her own stand inside the municipal market of Itá and she took advantage of this. Today she uses it to sell products that she purchases from butchers in the area. She says that things are going well for her and that she has established a very good clientele. She is very proud of herself because up until now she continues to manage her stand and thanks to that her children are able to study while she never had the opportunity to due to her bad economic situation. At this time she is requesting a loan to buy products since there is so much demand for her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
El Sr. Víctor vive en pareja con Rosa hace 7 años. De la unión de ambos ha nacido un niño que hoy tiene 5 años de edad.

El Sr. Víctor comenta que su señora tuvo que emigrar a España por que aquí en el país no consiguió un trabajo seguro debido a que no posee un nivel de estudio apropiado.

Víctor se dedica a la venta de mercaderías como ser: zapatos, calzados deportivos, jeans, camisas y otros tipos de indumentarias. Afirma que debe doblar esfuerzos de manera a conseguir los ingresos necesarios para poder mantener a su pequeño hijo.

Su deseo es lograr adquirir un local propio para la comercialización de sus mercaderías y así poder tener de regreso a su esposa.

En esta oportunidad solicita un crédito para la compra de más mercaderías a fin de aumentar el stock de los mismos.
texts.en:
Victor has lived with his partner Rosa for seven years. From their union they have a five year old son. Victor says that his wife had to emigrate to Spain because in his country she couldn't find work since she did not posses the appropriate education. Victor sells merchandise like dress shoes, sports shoes, jeans, t-shirts and other clothing items. He affirms that he should double his efforts to earn what he needs to be able to support his young son. His wish is to acquire his own locale where he can sell his merchandise and that way be able to have his wife return. At this time he is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise with the objective of increasing his stock.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel A. is 41 years old, married and a father with six children. Right now all his children are in a community school in the town where he lives. Samuel lives in a farming community called Abofour, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Abofour is a forest reserve area and the most popular occupation is farming. Most of the people are farmers and the illiteracy rate there is very high among the adults. 

Samuel is a seasoned farmer and he has been farming cocoa and cereals like maize for more than twelve years, to take care of his family. Through this, he has managed to build a two bed room house in the village. Samuel says he has large acres of cocoa and maize and that he is been facing a problem on the farm as there is a disease attacking his cocoa crops.
.
For this reason, he wants a loan assistance to buy farm items like cocoa chemicals, spraying machines, fertilizers to nurse his cocoa, and agro chemicals etc. With the loan Samuel believes he would have the resources to harvest more this year. 

Samuel would also like to use part of his profit to take care of family expenses, especially in the area of the children's education. Samuel belongs to a village bank called Jabaz. He hope to receive GH¢500 to improve his business by restocking his inventory. This would enable his save more to support his family.

loans.use: To buy farming products like agro chemicals, fertilizers and farm equipment.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica B. is a 35 year old local restaurant operator. She is widowed and has three kids who attend school in the community. Monica lives at Abofour, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region. And she has been there since she started her local restaurant. Monica's husband died painfully after a short illness. And now the burden of the family rest on her shoulders.

She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared by pounded cassava and plantain, and taken with all kinds of soup. She cooks only on Thursdays because that is their market day where people come to trade. With her tasty meals she has attracted a lot of customers in the area where she serves. Therefore it has become necessary to employ additional hands to assist her with the food delivering service. She also sells raw food stuff like plantain at the market.

Monica says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance. Monica belongs to a village bank called Fear Not. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to increase her business by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more and support her kids in school, as single parent.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Martiza Mercedes Viii Group

texts.en:
The Bank of Hope "Maritza Mercedes" is located  in El Seybo. Group 8 has just gotten approval on their third loan. All members of this group will be investing their money directly in merchandise purchases. Sandra M. is the group representative. Her business consists of selling shoes. 

In the future, these micro-entrepreneurs state that they'd love to see better lives for their children, good health-care and education, they'd like to grow their business ventures further, and some would like to continue their own studies (at the secondary and university level). Sandra has set herself the goal of building her own house. 

The picture provided shows these group members gathered at the Esperanza office in El Seybo. 

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: purchase shoes and sandals

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana Y. is a 35-year-old mother of a child who is currently in senior high school. She lives and works at Abofour in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Nana lives with her husband who is a farmer in the village. Nana is very hard-working and resourceful for her family. She sells charcoal in her neighborhood. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes.

Nana obtains her supply of charcoal from the villages surrounding Abofour, where she lives, and retails it to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of charcoal to increase her inventory. She hopes the loan would enable her to increase savings to pay her child’s educational fees.

Nana belongs to a village bank called "Fear Not". She hopes to receive GHS 500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to help her husband in taking care of the household.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of charcoal

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu I. is a 52-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of six kids. Salamatu resides at Abofour with her family. Salamatu lives with her husband in a rented apartment in the community. Her husband, she said, is very supportive in taking care of the kids.

Salamatu is a food vendor who sells "kenkey" in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. In addition, she also sells raw foods such as bags of maize at the market square of Abofour.

Salamatu wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her children, especially to pay for their education. Salamatu belongs to a village bank called ‘Fear Not’. She also hope to receive GHS 500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to help her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Maritza Mercedes Group

texts.en: "Maritza Mercedes" is a group of 5 women all hoping to receive their third loan cycle. This group has all already got a start on their small business, and have started to experience some success. The representative of this group is a very hardworking women named Sandra M.. Sandra is the mother to 3 children, and started a small business selling shoes in her area. Before her first loan, Sandra had no real form of income, and had no way to pay for all the basic needs of her children. She came to Esperanza International really hoping to change her life, and with a great desire to succeed. With each loan Sandra has been able to increase the size of her shoe business, and for the first time in her life she feels like she can provide for her children. She is starting to make money, and so excited for her future. When we talked to Sandra she said that she wants nothing more in life than to see her children succeed, and live comfortable lives. Sandra is on the way to reaching that dream, and is very excited about this next loan. Thank you for all of your support!!

loans.use: Buy shoes for her business

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
La venta de alimentos especialmente el vigoron es el negocio al que se dedica la señora Flor L. desde hace 5 años con el propósito de mantener su hogar compuesto por su pequeño hijo el cual tiene la obligación de mantener por ser menor de edad y además por ser una madre soltera.

La razón por la cual ella hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de la comida y así continuar con su negocio brindando mejores condiciones alimenticias a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Food sales, especially vigorón (a concoction of yucca, coleslaw and fried pigskin) has been the business of Mrs. Flor L. for five years. She must support her household comprised of her small son that she must take care of since he is a minor and she is a single mother. The reason she has come to Ceprodel today is to request a loan that will allow her to purchase food and continue running her business, offering the best possible food to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua el señor Juan A. se ha destacado por ser un comerciante de verduras teniendo su propio establecimiento donde todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana se alista para ofrecer los perecederos. 

El motivo por el cual espera en Ceprodel es para que sea aprobada su solicitud de crédito para la compra de los perecederos como cebollas, yuca, limones, zanahorias, chayotes, etc. Y por esto espera que su solicitud sea aprobada y así continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the wholesale market in the city of Managua, Mr. Juan A. has distinguished himself as a salesman of vegetables having his own establishment where every day starting in the very early hours of the morning he gets ready to offer his products. The reason why he's waiting in Ceprodel is to see if his credit application will be approved so he can purchase his perishable goods like onions, yuca, limes, carrots, chayotes, etc., and continue to run his business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Estela Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora Estela Ofelia se ha destacado en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua por tener su propio negocio de venta de frutas y verduras tales como granadillas y papayas las cuales son comercializadas por ella misma con el propósito de llevar el alimento a su hogar compuesto por sus cuatro pequeños hijos.

La razón que ella atraviesa hoy en día es que requiere del capital financiero para la compra de las verduras y frutas y por esto es que ha decidido esperar en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con este crédito y así salir adelante en su negocio por medio de sus grandes esfuerzos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Estela Ofelia has shined in her local market of Managua because she has her own business. In her business she has fresh fruits and vegetables. She also has other fruits as papayas which she sells commercially. With this income that she makes, she takes it home and uses it to feed her four small children.

Her current loan is to acquire more money so that she can purchase more fruits and vegetables. She has put her hopes on Ceprodel and hopes they give her the necessary credit go move ahead in life.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Fuente De Paz 8 Group

texts.en:
"Fuente de Paz" is a group of 5 all hoping to receive their 5th loan. This group has been one of the more successful groups, due to the fact that they are all extremely hard workers--and great friends as well. Francisca B. is the representative of this group and was excited to tell us about her life. She has had a very hard life and has been living in extreme poverty her whole life as well. 

Francisca is the mother of 3 very young children, all being under the age of 6 years old. She even has a child who is 1 month old. A few years back, Francisca came to Esperanza International because she knew she wanted her children to live a better life than she had had. She received her first loan, and started a small business selling clothing. She experienced success with her very first loan and her business has been growing ever since! She finally is able to provide her children with all the basic needs and put them in school. She is very excited to keep growing her business, and she hopes to have a big clothing store someday. She wants nothing more than to send her children to college and provide them with a good life. She is ready for this next loan and also very grateful! Thanks for your support!

loans.use: Purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Esperanza Cáceres R. tiene la edad de 68 años, su estado civil es viuda, Doña Esperanza tiene 2 hijas que trabajan por cuenta propia y no dependen de ella, sus propósitos son mejorar sus condiciones de vida por lo que tenía que proveer el sustento diario de su familia ya que a pesar de la edad que posee es una excelente clienta sus sueños son que su venta sea una distribuidora para que tener mas afluencias de clientes y proporcionar la estabilidad de su familia ya que en esta situación que nos encontramos pero ella tiene todo el interés de salir adelante con su negocio por muy pequeño que sea pues sus intereses de mantenerlo activo son la oportunidad de su vida.

La actividad económica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 16 años, esta actividad la inicia porque en el momento tenia la necesidad de proveer el sustento diario de su hogar por lo que tenia una serie de gastos al sufragar los gastos de la muerte de su compañero de vida para el año del 1996 conoce a la Fundación León 2000 y se incorpora al programa de recibir financiamiento con el objetivo de invertirlo en el negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y al mismo tiempo ha sabido demostrar las cualidades de una microempresaria con una visión bien definida y deseosa de mantener su línea de crédito y dada las circunstancias que atravesó decidió establecer una pulpería en su casa de habitación ya que a su edad era muy difícil obtener un trabajo y dio inicio con pocos productos como: granos básicos, hielo y golosinas pero Doña Esperanza logra captar la atención de sus clientes y es así como logra establecer este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que realizar las compras de sus productos y estas compras las realiza en las diferentes distribuidoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esperanza Cáceres R. is 68 years old and a widow. Esperanza has two daughters who are financially independent. She would like to improve her quality of life so that she can continue to support family. In spite of her age she has an excellent client base. She dreams of her store becoming a distributor so that she can attract more affluent clients and provide stability for her family. Esperanza would very much like to get ahead with her business, even though it is small, because keeping it active is the opportunity of a lifetime. Esperanza has owned a local store for 16 years, located in her home. Esperanza was prompted to start the store when her husband died. His death left her with a number of expenses, as well as the responsibility for providing for her family. In 1996 she approached the Fundación León 2000 and became part of the loan recipients program, with the objective of improving her quality of life. Esperanza had already demonstrated the qualities of a micro-entrepreneur, with her well-defined vision and the desire to manage a line of credit. Esperanza overcame a number of difficult circumstances in establishing her store, including the hard work for someone of her age and starting with very few products. Esperanza opened the store with only: basic grains, ice, and sweets. In spite of this, she was able to capture the attention of her clients and establish her business. This loan is for working capital so that Esperanza can buy her products from a variety of distributors.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rufina Miriam

texts.es:
La Señora Rufina Miriam Ríos A. tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Rufina tiene 4 hijos de los cuales sus edades son las siguientes una mujer de 32 años, un varón de 38 años, un varón de 33 y una mujer de 32 años todos trabajan por cuenta propia, su compañero de vida labora en la venta de mercadería en general, sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio activo por lo que necesita mantenerlo ya que su negocio es el medio de supervivencia de su familia, sus sueños son de tener otro trabajo ya que este seria otra fuente de ingresos y las ganancias de este negocio las conservaría para su vejez ya que su hijos están casado y trabajan por cuenta propia sus deseos son darle educación a jóvenes para que puedan generar mas fuente de trabajo ya que la mayoría de jóvenes hoy en día están desempleados y no encuentran trabajo y al menos con esto podrían generar ingresos para su familias.

Su actividad económica es la es un taller de costura, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación y además lo distribuye, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 37 años, ella inicio este negocio por la necesidad de aportar dinero para su casa  por lo que tenia que mantener a sus hijos y su Mama fue quien le enseño este tipo de negocio por lo que decide establecerlo pensando que le generaría ganancias y lo realiza por medio de sus vecinos y amigos que se hicieron cargo de difundir la fama de buena costurera y poco a poco llegaban los pedidos de uniforme de trajes personales y así fue que se hizo cargo de la administración de su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que lo utilizara para la compra de ropa par caballeros, damas y niños ya que se acerca la temporada de la entrada de clases y quiere invertir en esta temporada a pesar de la cansado que sea el viaje para buscar los productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rufina Miriam Ríos A. is 53 years old and married. Rufina has four children: a daughter, age 32; a son, age 38; a son, age 33; and a daughter, age 32. All of her children are independently employed. Rufina's husband also works, selling general merchandise. Rufina would like to keep her business active, as it is the means for the family's survival. She dreams of having another job to serve as a source of income for the family so that the earnings from this business will be saved for Rufina to support herself in her old age. Now that her children are all married and employed, Rufina would like to provide an education for the younger generation so that they can have more earning power. She knows that the majority of young people today can't find work, so with an education at least they can earn income for their families. Rufina has a sewing workshop in her home.She's had this business for 37 years, having started it out of the necesity to earn money for her home and her children. Rufina's mother taught her this business, and she started it with the hope of earning income. She was able to achieve this because her neighbors and friends spread the word, making Rufina famous for her great sewing. Little by little orders for uniforms and suits came in, and Rufina was in business. This loan will be used as working capital to buy clothing for men, women, and children. The school year is starting soon and Rufina would like to invest this season in spite of the long journey necessary to buy the products.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kenneth Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Kenneth Antonio E. C. tiene la edad de 29 años, su estado civil es casada, el Joven Kenneth tiene 3 hijos su edades son las siguientes un varón de 10 años y cursa recientemente el 4 grado de primaria su otra hija de 3 años de edad no estudia y su otro hijo de 1 año todavía no estudia, su compañera de vida labora como enfermera,   los propósitos del Joven Kenneth son de mantener su negocio ya que es el único medio de ingresos que el posee para sustentar a su familia mas sin embargo no todos los jóvenes se dedican a este tipo de negocio sus sueños son de incrementar su producción en los diseños de trajes para su amplia clientela ya que así lograría innovación en el mercado y sus productos no solo serian recomendados por personas de este país si no que también serian enviados al extranjero y este le proporcionaría mas ganancias sus deseos son de comprar maquinas para proporcionar mas trabajos a personas que realmente desean salir adelante y proporcionar cierta estabilidad para sus familias ya que la mayoría de las familias hoy en día están mantenidas por las mujeres.


La actividad a la que se dedica es brindar el servicio de sastre, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que el Joven Kenneth tiene de poseer el negocio es de 10 años, el inicia este negocio cuando tenia 19 años de edad ya que no tenia trabajo y necesitabas urgentemente un ingresos que le proporcionara un respaldo y ayudar en los gastos de su familia por lo que decide ofrecer sus servicio como sastre por lo que inicio con la elaboración de trajes para niños, trajes para damas y caballero al comienzo esto lo consigue por que sus vecinos recurrían a su vivienda en busca de sus servicio al presenciar la afluencia de clientes que logro decide invertir sus ganancias para capital de trabajo y el lograr lo que ha obtenido hasta el día de hoy fue una experiencia que lo ha ayudado a cambiar en la perspectiva de la vida, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de materia prima como: ropa, agujas, hilos, tijeras pero sobre todo en la compra de tela para uniformes ya que se acerca la temporada de la entrada de clases y aprecia la ayuda brindada de parte de la Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas que solo quieren el progreso de nosotros mismos.
texts.en:
Mr. Kenneth Antonio E. C. is 29 years old and married. Kenneth has three children. His son is 10 years old and in the fourth grade. His daughter is three years old and not yet in school, and his second son is 1 year old and not yet in school. Kenneth's wife works as a nurse. Kenneth would like to maintain his business, as it is the only means he has of supporting his family, and not all young people work in this type of business. He dreams of increasing production of suit designs to expand his client base. That way he would be able to achieve innovation in the market and his products would not only be recommended by people in this country but also be envied by foreigners. This would provide Kenneth with more earnings. He would like to buy more machines in order to give jobs to people who would truly like to get ahead and provide a measure of stability for their families, as the majority of families today are supported by women. Kenneth is a tailor, working from his home and also traveling through town. He has been in this business for 10 years, having started when he was 19 years old. At the time he didn't have a job and needed income urgently in order to support his family. He therefore offered his services as a tailor, initially making suits for children, women, and men. He was able to support himself because his neighbors kept returning to his store.Kenneth gained fame because he as able to show off the affluence of his clients. Kenneth decided to invest his earnings as working capital and he had experiences that changed his perspective on life. His loan will be used as working capital to buy materials such as: clothing, needles, thread, and scissors. Above all, Kenneth would like to buy cloth for uniforms, as the school year is approaching. He appreciates the help of Fundación León 2000 and its partner organizations, which want to see their clients progress.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Karla Elisa

texts.es:
La Joven Karla Elisa García C. tiene la edad de 31 años, su estado civil es soltera, Karla no tiene hijos, sus propósitos son de seguir proveyendo esa fuente de ingresos que lo logra por medio de su trabajo ya que es una joven que piensa en el futuro por lo que con la ayuda del tiempo puede lograr sus objetivos propuestos, sus sueños son de establecer de manera permanente su negocio en local donde pueda ofrecerle cómodamente a sus clientes sus productos, sus deseos son de que su negocio sea una tienda de ropa en donde sus clientes encuentren todo lo que buscan ya que así podrá satisfacer los diferentes gustos que tienen sus clientes además en sus deseos esta el complacer a su Mama ya que orgullosamente es ella quien se hace cargo de los gastos de su hogar ya que esto la ayudado a madurar para soportar los golpes de la vida.

La actividad económica a la que Karla se dedica es la venta de ropa, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 6 años, esta Joven Karla inicia este negocio por la necesidad de proveer otra fuente de ingresos para su hogar ya que el salario fijo que tenia no le ajustaba por lo que decide introducir ropa cosméticos al crédito y al contado a compañeras del trabajo y amigas  e incluso a compañeros que estudiaron con ellas contando con el apoyo de una prima quien ya se dedicaba a la actividad y proveía de productos que posteriormente pagaba después de recuperar sus cuentas por cobrar, luego conoce de Fundación león 2000 y se incorpora el programa trabajando de inmediato sola y ella realizaba las compras por docena para luego ofrecerlas a los diferente clientes y un así continua realizando las dos actividades económicas para sacar adelante a su familia, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado a la inversión del negocio con el propósito de mantenerlo activo además esta la inversión para los uniformes que son los pedidos que mas ha recibido.
texts.en:
Karla Elisa García C. is a 31 year-old young woman. She is single and does not have children. Her goals are to continue providing this source of income that she makes through her work. While she is young, she thinks about the future because, with the passage of time, she will be able to reach her proposed goals. Her dreams are to permanently establish her business in a place where she can comfortably offer her customers her products. Her hope is that she will have a clothing store where her customers find everything they are looking for and, in that way, she will be able to satisfy the different tastes her customers have. In addition to these hopes, it is her desire to please her mother because she is the one who proudly bears the costs of the household which has helped her to mature to withstand the challenges in life. Karla sells clothing as a street vendor. She has had her business for 6 years. This young woman, Karla, started her business because of a need to provide another source of income for her home since her salary was not adjustable. It was for this that she decided to sell cosmetics and clothes, offering payment by credit or cash, to her co-workers and friends, including her classmates. She counted on the support of her cousin who has worked in this business and who provided her with products that she would later pay her back for after getting paid herself. Later she learned of Fundación León 2000 and she joined the program, working immediately. On her own, she made purchases by the dozen which she later offered to her different customers. In this way she continues doing two business activities to get her family ahead. The financing is for business capital to be used to invest in her business with the goal of keeping it active and to buy uniforms of which she has more orders than stock.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos Antonio R. García tiene la edad de 41 años, su estado civil es soltero, Carlos tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguiente su hijo mayor de 18 años cursa el 4 año de secundaria y su hijo menor de 10 años cursa el 4 grado de primaria, sus propósitos son de representar la calidad de su ganado ya que esto le daría un mejor prestigio, sus sueños son de incrementar su negocio ya que así obtendría mas ingresos para su familia y les ofrecería mas estabilidad a sus hijos ya que están en una etapa en la cual es necesario que se preparen para el día de mañana, sus deseos son de comprar un terreno que estará destinado para sus hijos para que el día de mañana no pasen dificultades y sepan lo difícil que es trabajar y así logren interesarse por el negocio ya que esto le serviría  de beneficio como medio de trabajo.

Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ganado menor y mayor, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 5 años, Don Carlos inicio este negocio con el objetivo de apoyar en los gastos de la familia y también es importante resaltar que Don Carlos es agricultor por lo que decide introducirse a este negocio ya que no fue fácil superar la situación con su esposa pero aun así recurría las diferente comarcas en busca del ganado que estuviera en venta para el hacer ofertas de pago por lo que no fue difícil aprender este tipo de negocio y además de la compra de ganado le intereso la venta de cerdo por lo que a esta también le sacaba provecho, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de los diferentes animales tanto ganado como cerdo.
texts.en:
Carlos Antonio R. García is 41 years of age and is single. Carlos has 2 children, his oldest son is 18 years old and is in his fourth year of high school and his youngest son is 10 years old and is in his fourth year of primary school. His goals are to show the quality of his cattle since this is what will increase his prestige. His dream is to expand his business to be able to earn more for his family and to provide more stability to his children now that they are in a stage when it is necessary to prepare for the future. He hopes to buy land for his children so that they do not have difficulties in the future and for them to know how difficult it is to work and so that they become interested in the business which would be a benefit to them and also a way of working.

He purchases and sells large and small livestock. His business is located in his home. He has had this business for five years. Don Carlos started his business with the goal of meeting his household expenses. It is important to highlight that Don Carlos is a farmer who decided to start in this business since it was not easy to survive the situation with his wife. Despite this, he resorted to the different regions in search of livestock for sale so that he could make offers to buy. For this reason, it was not difficult for him to learn this type of business. He was interested in the selling of pigs which also benefited him. The financing is for business capital that he needs to buy different animals, cattle as well as pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Fransisico Javier

texts.es:
El Señor Francisco Javier M. Balmaceda tiene la edad de 47 años, su estado civil es casado, Don Francisco tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 12 años y cursa el 5 grado de primaria y su hija de 3 años de edad que no estudia, su compañera de vida labora por cuenta propia, sus propósitos son de incrementar su negocio ya que sus preposiciones están enfocadas en el progreso de su negocio, sus deseos son de obtener otra ruta urbana para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos y de su esposa para que el día de mañana sus hijos puedan hacerse cargo del negocio y tenga la experiencia necesaria para manejar todas las situaciones que se les presenten, sus sueños son de expandirse como transportista para lograr tener mas clientela y mantener a su familia ya que este seria uno de los métodos para que el dinero ajuste para los pagos del hogar y de la familia.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es transportista, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 4 años, Don Francisco inicio este negocio con un vehiculo usado por lo que así fue como empezó a trabajar con este vehiculo tenia que realizar los tramite para que su vehiculo recorriera las calles con todos sus papeles en orden por lo que no fue nada fácil llevar a cabo sus propósitos Don Francisco al adquirir este vehiculo tuvo que hacer un préstamo a su familia y con las ganancias obtenidas ha logrado pagar la deuda  poco a poco y agradece a Dios por tener un trabajo digno y humilde para la manutención de su familia, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita los servicio de un mecánico para arreglar ciertas partes de su vehiculo ya que en los lugares donde transita son de acceso rural por lo que es necesario el chequeo constante de este vehiculo además tiene que proporcionar la seguridad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Francisco Javier M. Balmaceda is 47 years of age and is married. Don Francisco has two children, his oldest son is 12 years old and is in his fifth year of elementary school and his daughter is three years of age and is not yet in school. His partner in life works on her own. His goals are to increase his business now that he is focused in the progress of his business. He hopes to get another urban route to secure the future of his children and wife so that, one day, his children can be in charge of the business and will have the experience necessary to manage all of the situations that present themselves. He dreams to expand his transportation services so that he has a larger clientele and to support his family since this could be one of the ways for his income to cover the household expenses.

He is a transportation provider offering his services as a street vendor. He has had this business for 4 years. Don Francisco started this business with a used vehicle. He started using this vehicle once he had all of his papers in order and completed the process to allow his vehicle to travel throughout the streets. It has not been easy to do. To acquire this vehicle, Don Francisco had to ask his family for a loan and, with his earnings, he has been able to pay back the debt little by little. He thanks God for having decent and humble work to support his family. The loan is for business capital since he needs the services of a mechanic to repair certain parts of his vehicle. Now that he travels in rural areas it is necessary to constantly check the vehicle to ensure the safety of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Mercedes del Carmen C. H. tiene la edad de 43 años, su estado civil es casada, Mercedes tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 15 años cursa el 2  año de secundaria y su hijo menor de 10 años cursa el 5 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora como operario, sus propósitos son de mantener activo su negocio ya que este es su único medio de vida para ella y su familia sus deseos son de obsequiarles a sus hijos una casa donde puedan vivir en futuro con sus familias por lo que es importante para que se independicen de una forma segura sus sueños son de proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda ya que le gustaría que toda su familia se encuentra cómoda y segura por lo que así no tendrían problemas en la temporada de lluvia ya que tienen problemas en su vivienda.

La actividad económica es la de mercadería en general como: calzado, ropa y cosméticos, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 3 años, Doña Mercedes inicia su negocio como todo negocio pequeño por lo que primero se dedico a la venta de cosméticos y sus clientes le realizaban pedidos de diferentes marcas por lo que mas tarde decide implementar en el negocio la venta de de calzado y sus clientes siempre en busca de sus servicio ya que ofertaba sus productos de casa en casa y por idea de una de sus clientes decide además vende ropa y ya con esta mercadería salio adelante con su familia y esto se realizo con mucho esfuerzo por que sabia la responsabilidad de su familia, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que su interés es de realizar la compra de uniformes y calzado por la temporada de clases que se avecina.
texts.en:
Mercedes del Carmen C. H. is 43 years old and married. She has two children, a 15-year old son in high school and a 10-year old son in elementary school. Her husband is a factory worker. Her goal is to keep the business going because her family's income depends on it. She wants, in the future, to give each of her children a house where they can live with their families so that they can be both independent and secure. She also wants to make improvements to her house because she would like her family to be comfortable and safe, free of the problems they have during the rainy season.

Mercedes makes a living selling general merchandise: footwear, clothing and cosmetics. She is a street vendor and has operated her business for 3 years. Like many small businesses, she started out selling a single product, cosmetics, and then added other products, such as footwear, as she built a base of customers. Her customers like the service that she provides and look to her for new products. That's how she got the idea to sell clothing, a product that will help her to help her family, a responsibility that she feels deeply. Selling clothes requires a lot of effort, though. The loan will be used for working capital so that Mercedes can buy uniforms and footwear appropriate for the upcoming school year.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Alex Mauricio

texts.es: alex es un joven de 24 años de edad quien se dedica a la actividad comercial desde los 19 años, debido a que proviene  de una familia que le inculco ser su propio jefe, el es casado y tiene una hija de 2 años la cual piensa ingresar al prekindrer o maternal el proximo año, el en estos momentos esta estudiando administracion de empresas en la universidad, actualmente se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en su casa de habitacion, dicha actividad le genera ingresos necesarios para mantener la familia y su hogar tambien para pagar sus estudios, el necesita un credito para poder hacer crecer su negocio un poco mas. ya que las necesidades y exigencias de los clientes son muchas y necesita tener mas variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Alex, 24, is a young man, but he started operating his business when he was even younger, at 19, full of his family's advice to be his own boss. He's married and has a daughter, 2, who he's thinking of enrolling in day care next year. He's also studying business administration at the university. Alex makes a living operating a grocery business that he runs from his house. The business generates enough income to support the family and pay for Alex's studies. He needs a loan so that he can grow the business a bit more. His customers have a lot of needs and demands and he needs a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for grocery business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bismark Antonio

texts.es:
El caballero Bismark M. es originario de la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua y se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de carne de pollo en el mercado con el propósito de mantener su núcleo familiar proporcionando las condiciones necesarias de vida a su cónyuge y sus dos pequeños hijos. 

Hoy en día la razón por la que el señor Bismark ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita adquirir la carne de pollo para su respectiva comercialización. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente y beneficia de igual forma a su amada familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
The gentleman Bismark M. is from the city of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua, and he works attending to his business selling chicken in the market with the purpose of supporting his family by providing the necessary living conditions for his wife and two small children. Today the reason why Bismark has applied to Ceprodel is to benefit from a loan that will allow him to acquire the chicken for its respective sale. With this loan he will benefit greatly as will his beloved family that so greatly requires your help.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken

loans.name: Ines Bladimir

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua el señor Ines Bladimir C. es un caballero que se ha destacado en la venta de ropa y relojes comercializados desde muy tempranas horas en su localidad donde atiende muy amablemente.

Sus inicios fueron muy duros ya que vendía poco y por esto no percibía utilidades pero a medida que Ceprodel le fue brindando créditos ha venido mejorando en su negocio. Es por este motivo que hoy en día una vez más acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de la ropa y los relojes y así continuar en este negocio que es el único sustento que tiene.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua, Mr. Ines Bladimir C. is a gentleman who has stood out in the sale of clothing and watches,which are sold from the very early hours in his locale which he attends to very kindly. His beginnings were very hard and he sold little and this is why he did not make a profit but through the loan from Ceprodel he has been improving his business. It is for this reason that today once again he is applying to Ceprodel to receive a loan for the purchase of clothing and watches and through this continue in this business which is the only support he has.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Carlos Miguel

texts.es:
El caballero Carlos L. desde hace seis años se ha dedicado a su negocio de carnicería el cual fundó con el propósito de mejorar sus ingresos económicos y brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su amada familia.

Con gran ahínco y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante y a pesar de los infortunios que en ocasiones presenta la vida, este caballero ha llevado el sustento a su amada familia. La razón por la que hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de la carne para comercializarla. Es importante destacar que dicho crédito le urge que sea entregado lo más pronto posible para continuar con su desarrollo en el negocio hoy en día.
texts.en:
The gentleman Carlos L. has had a butcher business for the past six years which he founded with the purpose of improving his income to provide better conditions to his beloved family. With great effort and dedication he has managed to get ahead and despite the unfortunate things that life presents on occasion, this gentlemen has provided for her beloved family. The reason why he has come to Ceprodel today is to receive a loan that will allow him to buy meat to sell it. It is important to highlight that this loan needs to be delivered as soon as possible to continue with the development of the business presently.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat

loans.name: Gustavo José

texts.es:
El señor Gustavo G. desde hace dos años decidió invertir en su negocio de servicio de reparación de bicicletas atendiéndolo todos los días y siendo visitado por varios clientes en su establecimiento en la ciudad de Managua.

Es importante destacar que en este negocio ha adquirido vasta experiencia por lo que es muy buscado para realizar este tipo de trabajos el cual es su sustento diario. Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito y es por esto que espera que su crédito sea aprobado a lo inmediato para así comprar las herramientas y continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Two years ago Mr. Gustavo G. decided to invest in his bicycle repair business, which operates everyday and is visited by various clients in his establishment in the city of Managua. It is important to highlight that in this business he has acquired vast experience which is why he is very sought after to carry out this type of work which is his daily sustenence. Today he has come to Ceprodel to benefit from a loan and this is why he hopes that his loan be approved immediately so that he can buy tools and continue his business.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of parts

loans.name: Unidas Por Fe Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo solidario Unidas por fe, originarias de la comarca El Valle de La Laguna, está compuesto por tres integrantes que son:   Justa Pastora S., Guillermina I. R. y Digna Marina H.. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras conocidas por su actividad en su comarca.
Doña Justa Pastora S. de 47 años de edad, soltera, madre de tres hijos, actualmente vive con una hija que le ayuda en el negocio y los quehaceres del hogar.
Ella se dedica a la venta de escobas y especias como canela, achiote, manzanilla, etc, vende en los mercados de Masaya y Granada de forma ambulante, tiene 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad pues la aprendido de su madre.
El crédito lo necesita  para comprar especias que las compra en Managua y las escobas la compra en la comunidad a mujeres que hacen escobas de trigo elaboradas a mano.
Espera poder comprar al por mayor y empacar especias con una marca de su nombre, para esto se compromete a pagar bien sus cuotas y ejercer solidaridad en su grupo y hacer uso de los financiamientos en comprar una selladora de empaque de bolsas plásticas.
texts.en:
This is the solidary group United Through Faith. They are from the area of El Valle de La Laguna. The group includes three members: Justa Pastora S., Guillermina I. R., and Digna Marina H.. They are very hard-working women who are known in their areas for their activities. Mrs. Justa Pastora S. is 47 years old, is single, is the mother of three children, and at present, she lives with one of her daughters, who helps her in the business and with the household chores. She sells brooms and spices, like cinnamon, annatto seeds, chamomile, etc. She sells these items by walking through the markets in Masaya and Granada. She learned this business from her mother and has been pursuing this activity for 20 years. She needs this loan to buy spices from Managua. She buys brooms from a community of women who make the brooms by hand from wheat. She hopes to be able to buy at wholesale and pack the spices with her own brand. Because of this, she is committed to pay her installments on time and have solidarity with her group. She will also use the financing to buy a pack of sealing plastic bags.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work and to offer more producers to their clients

loans.name: Grupo El Progreso Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo   El Progreso, que cuenta con  tres integrantes: Doña Ileana del Socorro S. G., Marisela del Socorro E. G. y Don José Adrián A. R., están ubicados en el Municipio de Diriomo, todos ellos vecinos.
Doña Ileana del Socorro de 50 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de Cosméticos en su comunidad, vendiendo de contado y crédito en menor grado, tiene 2 años de dedicarse a esta actividad porque considera que es un producto que se vende bastante y que las mujeres siempre necesitan a toda edad, además no es muy cansado una vez que ya tiene su clientela, ofrece productos en su casa y ambulante.
El crédito lo utiliza para comprar perfumes, desodorantes, bolsos de estudiante y todo en el ramo de cosméticos. Ella es viuda y vive acompañada de su nieto de 19 años que decidió vivir con ella, es estudiante y ella le apoya con sus gastos. Sus sueños de ella es ver graduado a su nieto en la carrera de Contabilidad y tener siempre su sustento.
texts.en:
This group is called The Progress, and it includes three members: Mrs. Ileana del Socorro S. G., Marisela del Socorro E. G. and Mr. José Adrián A. R., who live in the municipality of Diriomo. All of them are neighbors. Mrs. Ileana del Socorro is 50 years old and sells cosmetics in her community. She sells her products for cash and on credit to a lower degree. She has spent 2 years pursuing this activity because she considers this product to be one that sells very well and one that women of all ages will always need. Also, it is not very tiring. Once she has a client, she offers her products in her house and by walking. This loan will be used to buy perfumes, deodorants, student bags, and a whole range of cosmetics. She is a widow and lives with her nineteen-year-old grandson, who decided to live with her. He is a student, and she supports him with his expenses. Her dreams are to see her grandson graduate into an accounting career and to always have sustenance.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest more capital into her business so that she can satisfy her clients

loans.name: Grupo Belen #2 Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Belén #2 que tiene cinco integrantes Doña Soraya M., Ma. Teresa D., Kenya Francisca P. M., Ma. De los Ángeles S. Vásquez, Auxiliadora del Rosario M. C., originarios de la comunidad Palo Quemado que pertenece al Municipio de Diriomo, ellos son vecinos de origen humilde con actividades de venta de tortillas, tamales y fritanga.
Doña Soraya M. de 30 años de edad, casada con dos niños, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos familiares pues trabaja de vigilante en una empresa en Managua. La señora vende comida en una escuela y vende Nacatamales los fines semana en su casa de habitación, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad porque los ingresos eran pocos y decidió apoyarle a su esposo, expresa que esto le ha permitido darle a sus hijos un mejor nivel de vida y así tomar decisiones en su hogar. Ella sueña que sus hijos continúen estudiando y ella poder engrandecer su negocio.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar perecederos, frutas, carne, leña y poder comprar algunas utencilios que necesita para cocinar.
texts.en:
This is the group Birth #2, which has five members, including Mrs. Soraya M., Ma. Teresa D., Kenya Francisca P. M., Ma. De los Ángeles S. Vásque, and Auxiliadora del Rosario M. C.. All of them are from the community of Palo Quemado in the municipality of Diriomo. They are neighbors with humble means, who pursue activities, like selling tortillas, tamales, and fried foods. Mrs. Soraya M. is 30 years old and is married with two children. Her husband helps her with the family expenses, as he works as a security guard in a company in Managua. Mrs. Soraya M. sells food in a school and sells Nacatamales on the weekends in her home. She has spent three years pursuing their activity because she was earning little income and decided to support her husband. She says that her business has allowed her to give her children a better life and make decisions in her house. She dreams that her children will continue studying and that she can expand her business. This loan is needed to buy perishables, fruits, meat, and firewood. She will also buy some utensils that are needed to cook.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her business and invest in cooking utensils

loans.name: Ni Wayan Sundri

texts.id:
Hidup sebagai seorang janda dengan pendapatan yang tidak seberapa dari pensiunan almarhum suaminya membuat Ni Wayan Sundri harus berusaha keras untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya.   Bekerja sebagai buruh  di sebuah usaha mebel ternyata belum mampu untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya, sehingga Ni Wayan Sundri memutuskan untuk mencari tambahan penghasilan dengan menjual kayu-kayu bekas yang sudah tidak terpakai lagi untuk dijadikan kayu bakar. Kayu-kayu yang tidak terpakai itu diperolehnya di tempatnya bekerja sebagai buruh karena dari proses pembuatan mebel ada kayu-kayu yang tersisa dan tidak bisa dipakai. Kayu-kayu tersebut dibelinya dan akhirnya dijual kepada langganannya.   
	Dari usaha ini Ni Wayan Sundri mendapat sedikit keuntungan yaitu sekitar Rp 50.000,- sampai Rp 75.000 setiap minggunya dan itu dipakainya untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya sehari-hari dan belajar untuk bisa menabung sebagai persiapan dalam menjalani masa tuanya. Ni Wayan Sundri mendapat pinjaman modal dari Dinari dengan jangka waktu 5 (lima) bulan dan pembayaran dilakukan setiap satu minggu sekali
texts.en:
Ni Wayan Sundri is a widow who lives from his late husband's pension fund. She has to work for extra income due to the pension fund is not enough. She works as a laborer in a local furniture shop during the day. In addition she also collects used wood or left over wood and sells them as firewood. She buys the left over wood from the furniture shop where she works as laborer staff.

She can earn USD 4 to USD 6 a week from this firewood selling business. She uses the money for her daily needs and also for her pension fund saving.

She gets a loan from DINARI foundation so she can buy more left over woods. This is a 5 month loan and she will make the installment payment once a week.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood

loans.name: Ni Putu Raka

texts.id:
Usaha warung yang dikelola Ni Putu Raka masih tergolong kecil dan sederhana.Usaha yang sama pun tidak ada di sekitar rumahnya,kalaupun ada sudah sangat jauh dari lokasi usahanya.Anak-anaknya sudah semua menikah sehingga saat ini Ni Putu Raka hanya tinggal bersama suaminya saja.
Warungnya adalah merupakan bagian dari rumah yang ditempatinya.Barang-barang yang dijual seperti makanan tradisional dan aneka macam barang-barang kebutuhan sehari - hari seperti beras, aneka makanan ringan, sabun, detergen dan lain - lain. Karena keterbatasan modal yang dipunyai, Ni Putu Raka belum mampu melengkapi warungnya dengan semua kebutuhan pelanggannya. 
Melalui Yayasan DINARI Ni Putu Raka mendapatkan dana pinjaman ayng dipakai untuk menambah modal usahanya.Saat ini aneka keperluan macam dagangananya sudah terlihat lebih lengkap lagi. Semua kegiatan untuk menjalankan usaha, baik memasak dan istirahat dapat dilakukan diwarungnya. Keuntunagn bersih dalam setiap harinya mencapai Rp. 30.000.- s/d Rp.50.000,- Hasil dari usaha ini Ni Putu Raka dapat memenuhi keperluan hidup bersama suaminya.
texts.en:
Ni Putu Raka is a housewife. She lives with her husband. Their children are married and live on their own.

Ni Putu Raka has a small warung (stall) that sells various daily necessities such as rice, snacks, soap, detergent etc. Due to limited capital she cannot really expanding her business.

She got a loan from DINARI foundation for her working capital. With this she can add more merchandise to be sold at her stall. She can earn a net profit of USD 3 to USD 4/ day.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add working capital

loans.name: Dok's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by four borrowers, all of whom live in Cheung Keub Commune in Kandal Province. The group leader, Mrs. S., is 58 years old and the mother of six children; three are single and the others are married and live away from home. She has been selling mushrooms in the market for more than eight years, and is earning an average of $5 per day. She usually buys the mushroom from a wholesaler and farmer to sell for a profit. She is married to Somnang, who is a local construction worker. S. is running her business well because she is skilled in attracting more clients. In order to make the business successful, S. is asking for a loan to buy more mushrooms for sale.

The other three borrowers are:

S. is a garment worker and she requests a loan for her husband to enlarge his business selling vegetables.

S. is a local electrician and he needs a loan for his wife to improve her business as a pork seller.

S. is a building supervisor and he is applying for a loan to buy more construction materials.

loans.use: To buy more mushrooms for sale

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Chen P., 47, pictured here with her husband, lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has operated a grocery stall from her home since 2003 to earn a living and is able to make US$ 5 every day. Her husband stays at home doing housework and helps his wife selling stuff. This couple has one young child. Mrs. Chen P. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1200 to expand her grocery store by adding more stuff to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: To expand their gorcery store

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey Y. is 47 years old and resides in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She lives with her husband and three of her children. Two of her children are construction workers and one stays home. Mrs. Srey Y. works selling grocery products and some kinds of vegetables from her home. On average, she earns US$ 2.50 per day. Her husband grows and sells rice. He earns an approximately US$ 3 every day. Her husband grows rice two times a year, rainy season and dry season.

To respond to high cost of living, Mrs. Srey Y. would like to take out a loan to purchase farmland for her husband to grow rice on; any remainder would be used to add her grocery inventory.

loans.use: To purchase land and add grocery products

loans.name: Rang

texts.en: Rang L. is 19 years old and resides with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She stays at home doing housework and cooking food. Currently, she is pregnant and hopes to have a baby in 5 months. Her husband, pictured here, stays at home making drums. The drums are made from palm trees. He can make around 4 to 6 drums a day to sell at the market to earn an approximate US$ 7.50 per day. This couple would like to take out a loan to purchase more palm trees to use to make drums.

loans.use: To buy palm trees to use to make drums

loans.name: Lek

texts.en: Lek S., 32, lives with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She stays at home doing housework and helping her husband making drums. Her husband, Tum Thyni, 30, pictured here, is a true entrepreneur who has had a business making drums since 2005. On average, he makes and sells about 5 to 7 drums at the market every day to earn approximately US$ 7.50. The drums are made from palm trees. This couple has three children and all of them are students. Mrs. Lek S. is asking for a loan to purchase palm trees to use to make drums.

loans.use: To purchase palm trees to use to make drums

loans.name: Ni Made Gunarmi

texts.id: Ni Made Gunarmi sudah menekuni menjadi peternak babi kurang lebih 10 tahun. Namun, menjadi peternak yang baik dan benar baru ia jalani dua tahun terakhir setelah mendapat pelatihan didesanya. Sekarang ia memelihara 5 induk babi. Satu ekor induk babi bisa melahirkan anak sebanyak 10 ekor. Harga 1 ekor anak babi Rp. 250.000.- setelah dipelihara selama 3 bulan. Saat ini yang menjadi kendala adalah naiknya harga pakan, sedangkan  untuk mendapat pertumbuhan yang baik, anak babi harus mendapat makanan yang berkwalitas setiap saat. Ni Made Gunarmi mengajukan pinjaman ke Yayasan Dinari yang akan dipergunakan untuk membeli pakan dan memperbaiki kandang. Dengan jangka waktu selama 6 bulan dan pembayaran pada akhir periode, Ni Made Gunarmi dapat mengatur pinjaman tersebut sehingga pada akhir periode ia sudah dapat menjual anak babinya dan bisa mengembalikan pinjaman
texts.en:
Ni Made Gunarmi has been a pig farmer for more than 10 years. However she only started to raise the pig with the correct methodology 2 years ago after she attended a training session at her village.

She is now raising 5 breeding pigs. One breeding pig can produce 10 piglets. A 3 month old piglets can be sold for USD 21. Her biggest concern now is the price of pig food. The price is keep going up while to have a good quality pig she need to give enough food.

She applies for a loan from DINARI foundation. The loan will be used to buy pig food and also the restore/ renovate the pig hut. This is a 6 month period loan with a baloon payment at the end of the loan period.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feed and to renovate hut

loans.name: Kun

texts.en: Kun S., 42, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She works running a grocery store, making about US$ 5 in revenue every day. Her husband is a professional painter. On average, he makes US$ 6 per day. This couple has four children, one of whom is in school. The oldest daughter works selling souvenirs in front of Angkor Temple.  Mrs. Kun S. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to expand her grocery store by adding more goods to meet her high customer demand.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store

loans.name: Hem's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by three members, all residents of Prek Ho Commune, Kandal Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Y. was selected to be group leader by the group members. Y., age 24, makes a living selling fish in the vicinity of Beung Trobek Market. She has been doing this since early 2008, and earns around of $5 each day. She is married and the mother of two children; both of them are still young and under her care. Her husband's name is Bunthorn, who is a truck driver in a small firm. Presently, Y. tries her best to make an income from her business. She hopes to expand the business, so she needs a loan of $300 to buy more fish to sell.

The other two borrowers are:

R., a widow, sells fish and she asks for a $250 loan to purchase additional fish for sale.

S. is a fish seller and a widow. She needs a loan of $150 to buy fish to sell for her daily income.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en: Chheang C., 56, sells grocery products and souvenirs to earn a living and is able to make US$ 8 every day. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. Her husband works selling wood, making around US$ 5 per day. This couple has three children, two of whom work selling souvenirs while one is in school. Mrs. Chheang C. would like to take out a loan of US$ 700 to purchase various kinds of souvenir products for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase various kinds of souvenir products for re-sale

loans.name: Ni Made Rani

texts.id: Hidup dengan suami dan 1orang anak yang masih balita, tentunya membutuhkan banyak biaya. Begitu juga hal yang dialami oleh Ni Made Rani. Sudah menjadi tradisi wanita di desa, salah satu usaha yang dilakukan untuk menambah perekonomian keluarga adalah beternak babi. Namun yang menjadi kendala adala kurangnya pengetahuan akan beternak babi yang baik dan benar sehingga usaha yang ditekuni tidak menghasilkan dengan maksimal. Sebelumnya, Ni Made Rani hanya memelihara satu babi penggemukkan dan hanya diberi pakan tradisional yang berupa dedaunan dan sisa makanan di dapur. Hal seperti itu menyebabkan pertumbuhan babi tidak optimal dan tentunya berpengaruh terhadap harga jual. Setelah mendapat pembinaan dan pinjaman modal, sekarang Ni Made Rani memelihara 4 ekor babi yang dipisah dalam dua kandang. Hal itu dilakukannya untuk memudahkan perawatan dan pembersihan kandang. Pinjaman itu digunakan juga untuk membeli pakan yang berkwalitas sehingga sekarang pertumbuhan babinya pesat dan sehat. Dengan adanya perubahan cara beternak, hal ini berpengaruh terhadap pendapatan keluarganya, karena sekarang ia dapat menjual babinya dengan harga yang lebih tinggi.
texts.en:
Ni Made Rani and her husband has one toddler. Having a small kid costs some money. Therefore she wants to do something to earn extra income. She wants to be in the business of raising pig. However she doesn't have a lot of knowledge about this area. In the past she tried to raise a pig but because her lack of know how, it didn't turn very well.

She is now received training and guidance from DINARI foundation in this area. She is now having 4 pigs which she raises in 2 separate huts. She also allocates part of the loan money for a better quality pig food so the pigs can grow well.

As she is now raising the pigs in much better way, she is hoping to get optimal result so she can earn additional income for the family.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs and feeds

loans.name: Lann

texts.en: Lann S., 26, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She sells vegetables at the market to earn approximately US$ 5 per day, while her husband also works and makes US$ 2 per day. This couple has one little child. Lann S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to commute to work. This will reduce the cost that he spends every day on public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Ni Komang Sukra Ratmini

texts.id: Setelah menikah, kini  Ni Komang Sukra Ratmini mulai membuka warung kecil di depan rumahnya.Usaha ini dipilih karena  di daerah tempat  tinggalnya belum ada  usaha warung yang  menjadi saingan dalam usahanya. Barang yang dijual pun beraneka macam seperti makanan ringan dan kebutuhan pokok setiap hari bahkan sayur mayur.Setiap hari Ni Komang Sukra Ratmini membuka warung pada pukul 07.00 wita dan tutup pada pukul 18.00 wita. Karena warung ada didepan rumahnya, maka jika tidak ada pelanggan yang berbelanja Ni Komang Sukra Ratmini bisa melakukan pekerjaan rumah tangga lainnya. Dalam menjalankan usaha ini Ni Komang Sukra Ratmini membutuhkan  dana untuk menambah usaha warungnya karena pelanggannya banyak sedangkan modal yang dimiliki sangat terbatas. Disamping melayani konsumen secara individu untuk kepentingan sendiri, Ni Komang Sukra Ratmini juga menjadi suplyer bagi para pedagang yang lain yang lebih kecil karena modal yang mereka miliki sangat kecil dan terbatas. Sekarang setelah Ni Komang Sukra Ratmini mendapat tambahan modal ia dapat melayani para konsumen lebih banyak lagi dengan keuntungan bersih perhari  mencapai Rp.150.000,- yang dulunya hanya memperoleh keuntungan bersih perhari Rp 50.000. Usaha warung ini ditekuninya dengan harapan  kedepannya usaha warung dapat lebih meningkat dan menjadi lebih besar lagi dari sekarang.
texts.en:
Ni Komang Sukra Ratmini opens a small stall in front of her house. She has been in this business since she got married. She decided to open a small stall because there was no other stall in her neighborhood.

She sells various stuffs in her stall such as snacks and vegetables. She opens the stall from 7 am to 6 pm everyday. As she has the stall in her house so she still can do the daily house chores.

She needs additional working capital as her customers are increasing so she needs to stock up more merchandises. With additional working capital she is able to increase her daily net income from USD 4.5 to USD 13. She is hoping that she can expand her business even more.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add working capital

loans.name: Dul

texts.en: Dul S., 28, is married and lives with three of her children in Siem Reap province. She and her husband work catching and selling fish in the market to earn a combined income of around US$ 8 every day. Mrs. Dul S. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to replace their old motor for their boat and purchase more fishing implements to catch more fish.

loans.use: To replace their old motor and purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mr. Phally S., 29, and his wife, Mrs. Sophoeun Phy, 28, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1999 and have three children; one son and two daughters. Two of their children attend school and another one is still young.

Phally has been a farmer and raising cow since 2000. His wife has been a silk weaver since she was twelve years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. 

Phally is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase wood silk materials for his wife weaving silk and one part of the loan to repair his house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for his wife’s weaving business and to repair his house.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun S. is 45 years old and resides with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been working making rice wine to earn a living and is able to make around US$ 4 every day, while her husband, Chhay Chha, 46, works growing rice and sometimes goes fishing in the rainy season. He makes around US$ 3 per day. This couple has 4 children; three are in school and one is at home. Sun S. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to replace their old motor for their boat; any remainder would be used to purchase a cow to help plow the farmland.

loans.use: To replace the motor for their boat and purchase a cow

loans.name: Ahror

texts.en:
K. Ahror is 39 years old and lives with his 4 children. For the past 8 years he has been farming, planting potatoes, onions and corn to sell as well as for his own family's consumption. Every day he tends to his fields. In the case of corn, he dries it and later threshes it, puts it in sacks and stores it for future sales. The process for planting his fields is first to prepare them with organic fertilizer, plow and sow them, and afterwards irrigate and apply fertilizer and insecticides, if necessary. All this is to insure a good harvest.

Ahror has a friendly family who always tries to help others. In the picture you can see Ahror’s son who also helps him with his business. At the same time, Ahror raises cattle in his house. He will invest the loan he is requesting in the purchase of organic fertilizers to prepare his land to raise potatoes and other crops.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Karamatullo

texts.en:
Karamatullo is a noble worker dedicated to raising animals, primarily sheep, which he buys and sells in commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him, because raising animals is what he has enjoyed since he was a young boy. Nevertheless he also has other jobs, and one of those is farming potatoes and corn in their respective seasons, taking in to account the bad weather that could damage his products. He requires a certain amount of money to increase the number of his sheep. His goal is to increase his product and thereby increase his household income, and to be solvent in order to continue buying and selling animals.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing sheep

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem K., 35, is married and lives with her young child in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She purchase bananas from individual growera and resells them to the market wholesaler. On average, she makes US $4 a day, while her husband grows and sells rice, earning US $3 a day. Nhem is asking for a loan to rent a banana farm and purchase farmland to expand her husband's rice crops.

loans.use: To rent banana farm and expand rice farm

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn M., 50, and her husband, Mr. Hul Hem, 58, live in a small village a long National Road Number Two about seven teen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1970 and have nine children; six sons and three daughters. Six of their children are married and five of them live outside the home. One child is a garment factory worker and the other two children attend school.

Morn has run a business buying and selling small trees in her village since 1999. Her husband has been a gardener since 1994. Morn is requesting a loan of $200 to use for growing small trees to sell.

loans.use: To use for growing small trees to sell.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem S. is 41 years old, a mother of six children and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She purchases rice crops from individual growers and resell it to earn approximately US $8 every day, while her husband is a carpenter and makes around US $10 a day. Six of her children are in school and sometimes work. Nhem would like to take out a loan to add to her rice stock to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: To add to her rice stock.

loans.name: Lilian Kizza ‘S Group

texts.en:
Lillian is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 29-year-old married woman with 3 children aged between 4 and 10 years. All her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She rents a two-roomed house where she lives with six people. They have electricity and no piped water at home The family gets three meals a day.

She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She works in Ntinda market selling matooke (bananas). Lillian works seven days a week and doesn’t incur any additional transport costs because she buys her goods from her place of work. Lillian sells to an average of 25 customers a day and sells to all categories of people. Lillian has been in this business for the five years and has in MCDT for six years, servicing her twelfth loan.
