Their customers prefer them because they are very amiable and pay particular attention to their clients. At present, they wish to expand their business and are requesting a loan in order to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat, oil, soft drinks, butter, plantains, beans, dairy products, tortillas and other products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Nueva Esperanza son personas luchadoras, responsables y con muchos deseos de superarse y salir adelante con sus negocios y tambien con sus familias, ellos son vecinos cercanos y tienen mucha experiencia en su trabajo.
 Ana D. tiene 5 años de dedicarse a la elaboracion y venta de nacatamales, desde niña le ha gustado las ventas y es asi como ella puso su negocio, sus ventas las realiza frente al Seguro Social, ella tiene clientes fijos de todos los dias y tambien vende a personas que pasan por el lugar, este lugar es muy transitado ya que al seguro social todos los dias entran una catidad grande de gente..  Don Gabriel D. sale a vender ropa usada a pueblos como ser punta raton, monjaras, pueblo nuevo, tiene 10 años de hacer esta actividad.  Dona Bricelda se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de pan dulce como ser semitas, galletas, quequitos, tortas etc. las cuales son muy ricas y sus vecinos le compran bastante, tambien cuenta con una pequeña tienda que vende cafe, azucar, jabon, papel higienico etc. todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder sacar adelante sus negociso y sus hogares.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza group are fighters; these are responsible people who want to overcome their situations and better themselves and their businesses. They are all close neighbours with a lot of experience in their work. Ana D. has been preparing and selling nacatamales for the past five years; nacatamales are a traditional Central-American dish wrapped in leaves and steamed. She has enjoyed selling since she was a young girl and that is how she started her business. She sells in front of the Social Security building and has regular customers as well as selling to passers-by. This is a very busy location as many people go to the Social Security building. Gabriel Dias travels to different villages such as Punta Raton, Monjaras, Pueblo Nuevo, to sell second-hand clothing; he has been in this business for 10 years. Bricelda has been making and selling sweet breads such as semitas (egg bread with anise seeds), cookies, small cakes, cakes and so on which are delicious: his neighbours buy most of his bread. He also has a small store where he sells coffee, sugar, soap, toilet paper, etc. The members of this group all need this loan in order to bolster their businesses and better their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make nacatamales.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es: La Sra. Maria reside en Hialeah, tiene 65 años de edad, sus hijos son independientes, desde hace  quince años vende  electrodomésticos y piñatas, que inicio con capital propio de lo que iba ahorrando, doña Maria hace préstamos los cuales se ha beneficiado para invertir en su negocio, con esta solicitud es la quinta la cual va invertir en electrodoméstico para vender a sus clientes unos encargos  que le han hecho, sus planes son vender otros productos en donde le generen mejores ganancias.  Así como terminar de hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
María lives in Hialeah and is 65 years old. Her children are now adults and she has sold domestic electronics and piñatas for 15 years. She began her business with her own savings. This is the fifth loan that María has requested, and she has used the other loans to invest in her business. She will use this loan to buy domestic electronics to sell to her customers, from whom she has already gotten a few orders. Her future plans are to sell other products that will generate more income, and to finish the improvements she is making to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy domestic electronics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer to improve production

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: La señora Cristina Isabel S. tiene la edad  de 27 años habita en el barrio San José Los Ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, ella es madre soltera, tiene a su cargo dos hijas que estudian la primaria, los planes hacia su familia mejorar las condiciones de vida; por lo tanto la señora se desempeña como comerciante y agricultora para poder cubrir los gastos de sus hijas, desde hace quince años se dedica a la agricultura ha podido mejorar su cultivo. El cual necesita mantenimiento y aplicaciones de fertilizantes, con esta solicitud de crédito va invertir en insumos agrícolas para obtener una mejor producción y ofertar mejor los productos al mercado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cristina Isabel S. is 27 years old and lives in San José Los Ríos in the municipality of Ticuantepe. As a single mother, she is responsible for two daughters that go to elementary school. Mrs. S. is a merchant and works in agriculture to cover her daughters' living expenses and to further her goal of improving her family's living conditions. Since she started in agriculture fifteen years ago, Mrs. S. has improved her crops, which nonetheless need fertilizers and upkeep. With this loan she will invest in agricultural supplies in order to improve her production and offer better products on the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and fertilizer to improve agricultural production

loans.name: Mahtab Nadera Group

texts.en: Mahtab Gul is the leader of the Mahtab Nadera group. The group members live in the 15th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. There are three members in this group. They want to take the loan for their business progress. Mahtab Gul wants to take a loan to buy wood and other required materials for her bakery. M.'s father wants to buy wood for his carpentry shop and Nadera wants to take a loan for her husband’s fruit cart. They all say that this loan will help them so much to grow.

loans.use: To buy various materials

loans.name: Nelofer Group

texts.en:
Nelofer is the group leader of Nelofer group. The members live in 15th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. The members want to take a group loan of 50,000 Afghani (USD$1075) for the term of 10 months. Each of the group members wants to take a loan to improve the progress of his or her business.

Nelofer's loan is for her brother’s fruit cart. Kemya wants to take a loan for sewing. Naqibullah wants to take a loan for his retail shop. Majeed wants to take a loan for the purpose of buying fuel for his shop.

The group members want to expand their businesses through the loan and support their families as well.

loans.use: To expand a fruit-cart business.

loans.name: Shame Paris Group

texts.en:
Razia is the group leader of Shame Paris group. They live in district 4, Kabul, Afghanistan and there are four members in this group. The total requested amount is 30,000 Afghani (USD$650) for the term of eight months and each of them would like to receive the loan for her own business.

Razia and Mah Jabin want to receive a loan for their tailoring businesses, Zia Gul wants to take a loan for her quilt sewing business, and Jamila wants to take a loan for her business of carpet weaving. They praise this process and want to thank Kiva, too.

loans.use: To improve her sewing business.

loans.name: Abdul Zohor Group

texts.en:
A. Zohor is the group leader of this group. There are two members in this group, A. Zohor and Aseyla.

A. Zohor wants to take a loan for his business of vegetable shop and he wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. Aseyla wants to take a loan for her husband's business, also a vegetable shop. Her husband wants to make his business larger.

They thank all lenders of Kiva in Afghanistan. They want to say that these loans help businesses progress and become larger. They thank the Kiva process in Afghanistan for supporting poor people.

loans.use: To expand his vegetable store.

loans.name: Zemar Group

texts.en:
Zemar is the group leader of Zemar Group. There are three members in this group. They live in Kabul Afghanistan and they would like to receive the loan to improve the business of each.

Zemar wants to take a loan for buying clothes for his shop. Shabana wants to take a loan for her father’s business; he has a retail shop. Nargis wants to take a loan for her sewing business. They are happy that they are supported through this process.

loans.use: To buy clothes for his shop.

loans.name: Taciana

texts.en:
Taciana L., 48, is married and lives at Bagting, Dapitan City. She has 2 children. Her husband works as a utility worker at CGSO.

Because of her eagerness to have a better life, she works hard and patiently and does manicure and pedicure services. Later on, she does other services such as hair coloring and hair cutting. She has her friends and neighbors as her regular customers and decided to open up a small beauty parlor. But she would need to have capital for these so she was looking for an institution that would be able to help her.

Taciana found Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and became a member on September 15, 2008. Her first loan of 3,000 php was used in buying materials and equipment for her business. She wants to purchase modern equipment, facilities and materials to increase her clientele and encourage them to look for her services so she has applied for a loan amounting to 7,000 php for additional capital. With her continued membership in Paglaum, she hopes to have a fully air-conditioned beauty parlor. She is willing to attend training, for acquisition of more skills.

loans.use: purchase of materials & chemicals for the beauty parlor

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoebe R. Velez, 41, is married and lives on Sunset Boulevard, Dawo Dapitan City. She has 4 children and all are in school. Her husband is her working partner in all she does.

They are managing “Sunset Pension and Beach Resort," inherited from her parents. Since there are local tourists and some foreigners who’d like to visit their resort, they want to maintain and improve the buildings so she looked for enough capital and found what she wanted at Paglaum MPC. She’s been a member since January 21, 2008. She is applying for 20,000 php for the purpose of repair and maintenance of the business establishment so as to provide a more desirable, accommodating and comfortable stay for their visitors. She aspires to send her children to school to have a degree for a better future.

loans.use: repair & maintance of their building

loans.name: Heltaf Group

texts.en:
Meerwais is the group leader of Heltaf group. There are five members in this group and they all live in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. They want to take a group loan to expand and bring some changes in their businesses.

Meerwais wants to take the loan for his tailoring shop. Farhed wants to receive the loan for his car part shop. M. Zarif for carpet weaving. M. Khalid for his burger shop. A. Q. for his business of selling clothes from a cart.

They say that the loan process is a good process which can support all entrepreneurs around the world.

loans.use: business progress

loans.name: Danya Nor Group

texts.en:
Sayadnor is the leader of this group. There are five members in the group and each of them would like to receive a loan for his/her own business.

Sayadnor Ahmady and Mastora want to take loans for their shops to expand them and to buy necessary materials. Leyda wants to take a loan for her business of beading and wants to buy necessary materials for her business. SayadA. Waley and Wayda want to take loans for their carpet weaving businesses, wishing to expand and progress their businesses.

With these loans they can support their families and make a better future.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma D., is 44-years old, married and lives in Owaon, Dapitan City. She has 3 children and 2 are in school. Her husband’s income, from his motor cab driving supports their basic daily needs.
She did not want to sit all day and wait for her husband to come home, so she started a small business that would generate an income. When she went to Dipolog, she saw, by accident, the Paglaum building and the Coop buildings. She inquired what Paglaum could bring into their lives. She was interested in joining and became a member on October 16, 2007. She used her first loan of 3,000 PHP as her capital in vending bananas. She became inspired to struggle and surpass all of the competitors in this business. She buys her supplies in “tabo-tabo”, a place in the area where many types of harvested crops are sold.

Today, she is requesting additional capital for buy bananas and other fruits to sell. She applying for a loan in the amount of  7,000PHP at Paglaum. She aspires to one day, own her own stall in the market for her banana vending business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and fruit for resale

loans.name: Servilla

texts.en:
Servilla S. is 55-years old and married to Regolo S., a carpenter. They live at Purok Santan, Owaon Dapitan City. They have 3 children and all are living with them.
	
Being a carpenter is not an easy task, so she wanted to help her husband by generating an income. At first, she had a garden at the back of their house and planted assorted vegetables and spices. Later, as she discovered that she was earning income and  decided to turn the activity into a small business. Her neighbors convinced her to join Paglaum MPC to acquire capital for her business. Fortunately, she liked the programs and services that Paglaum MPC offered and decided to become a member on January 16, 2007. Her first loan of 3,000PHP helped her to buy fertilizers and vegetable seedlings. The business runs smoothly and every week she has new customers to buy her sales products.
	
She is convinced that she could meet her weekly obligation so she has requested an amount of 11,000PHP because she’d like to start raising pigs as a  business. Her gardening business will still continue. She is very humble person and helps others in need.

loans.use: to start raising pigs as a business

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn J. is 48 years old, married, and lives at Obay, Polanco Zamboanga del Norte. Her husband is a motor cab driver. They have 6 children and 2 are in school, one in College and one in High School. Her husbands income is not enough to support the children's school tuition. 

She searched out a loan institution that will not turn it's back in times of difficulty. Roselyn found Paglaum MPC and decided to be a member on May 24, 2006. She decided to start a piggery business and started buying and selling pigs. Now, she has regular hog buyers that provide her with a income stable.  

Roselyn is requesting a 5,000PHP loan for another venture, to buy vegetable for resale. She also wants to buy more hogs to increase her income aside from her vegetable vending. She plans that her children will finish College.

loans.use: to buy vegetable for resale

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi F., 57 years old, is married and lives at Olingan, Dipolog City. Her husband, Robinson F., is a driver. She is blessed with 6 children and all are married. Because she has nothing to do around the house, she thinks of how she could enjoy her life. She tries to listen and sit in during the weekly center meeting of the PDP-LP (one of the programs of Paglaum MPC), and likes the idea of becoming a member, so she registered on April 10, 2006.

She borrowed an amount of 3,000 php and opened a sari-sari store. She’s been having fun, especially if she sees that she is gaining and her sales will be sold out for a week. At present, she has applied for 14,500 php. She wants to expand her sari-sari store and add more products to it. She wants to improve the status of her family and wants to help her children even if they are living elsewhere. She hopes to make her sari-sari store also a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional commodities for sale

loans.name: Lilybeth

texts.en:
Lilybeth G., a 48-year old, is married to Jaime G., presently residing at Purok Bularan, Miputak Dipolog City. Gifted with 4 children, she has 3 who are married and one is on her last year in High School. 

On January 30 of 2006, she enrolled to be a member of Paglaum MPC, since she has been interested in the benefits like dividend sharing and insurance at Paglaum. She is in need also of a capital because she wants to try managing her own business. Her first loan of 3,000 php was her stepping stone for a hog-raising business. Being a MIGS member of the Cooperative, she enjoys other services that the Cooperative gives. She availed herself of several loans and now she applies an amount of 14,500 php to buy feed and piglets.

She will do her best to help her youngest finish in college. And she will always continue patronizing Paglaum because of the big opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy feed & piglets

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle O., 46 years old, is married and lives at Dapitan City. She is blessed with 8 children, and 6 are still studying. Her husband is a plumber at Dapitan City Water District. At only 20 years old, she had already engaged in business by selling goods in front of their house.

Raising 8 children is not very easy, especially since there are more demands than her income provides. She has a fruit vending business in a rolling store and she also has a sideline as “labandera” (a term for women who labors in washing clothes.). Because of her aspiration to have all her children finish in school, on April 24, 2008, she joined Paglaum MPC and enjoys benefits from it. It also boosts her social skills. Her 3,000 php adds to her capital for buying fruits. With God’s grace, her business is going smoothly. Now she applies 7,000 php for additional fruits to display. She also wanted to have a place for her fruits at Dapitan Public Market. Being an optimist, she is a person who takes all life’s challenges and looks at life meaningfully.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits for sale

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia B., 42 years old, is married and lives at San Pedro, Dapitan City. She is blessed with 9 children, and only 5 are in school. Her husband is a driver and sometimes a laborer at Pier, Dapitan City.

They really experience crisis in their family, especially with financial matters. It is not easy to raise 9 children, and they need to sacrifice and work very hard for them to be able to eat. She joined Paglaum on April 27, 2007, and the loan she availed was used to open a sari-sari store in front of their house. They generate income from this, and she is able to send some of her children to school.

Just this January 16, 2009, she got a loan of 14,500 for the purpose of expanding her sari-sari store business, and she wants to add more grocery items, school supplies and other items to her store.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her sari-sari store

location.town: San Pedro, Dapitan City, Zambo.Del Norte

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan A., 42 years old, is married and lives at Bucana, Sicayab Dapitan City. Her husband, Reynaldo A., is an LTO Enforcer. They have 3 children, one who is already in College and the 2 are in Elementary School. Her husband’s salary cannot meet all their needs, so that’s why she struggles to have her own business. She used her husband salary to open-up a small sari-sari (small grocery) store in front of their house. But still the items of her store are not enough for the demand of her customers.

She heard about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and immediately joined the institution on July 20, 2007. She’s been a MIGS member of the Cooperative, so she has gotten several loans already. Now she’s applying for 10,000 php to buy basic goods for sale for her sari-sari store. 

She is looking forward to make her sari-sari store a mini-grocery someday for her to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy basic goods for sale

loans.name: Esparcia

texts.en:
Esparcia E., 46 years old, is married and lives at Isis, Polanco Zamboanga del Norte. She has 4 children and all are married. Her husband is a farmer and she wants to help him to have other income.

At first, they gathered wood, and most of their neighbors would come to their house and buy it to use as firewood. She decided then to make this a business, but they need to look for more capital. When she heard that Paglaum MPC has microfinance, she grabbed the opportunity to be a member as of August 31, 2007. Her loan of 3,000 php was very helpful with her additional capital from selling of firewood. As the days goes on, she is gaining from her business and has contributed income to her husband's for their daily consumption. Now she applies a loan of 7, 000 php for the purpose of improving the existing business. It would be enough for her to see the progress of her business, but she would also like to help to those in need.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta J. B., 39 years old, is married to Reynaldo B. and lives at Owaon, Dapitan City. Luckily, they have 4 children and all are in elementary school.

She dreams of the success of her children, because she doesn’t want them to have the difficulties they encounter right now. With all her strength, she always researches new strategies in earning money. So she came up with hog-raising as an idea. But she hasn’t enough capital in this business and has tried to ask some of her friends, and they referred her to Paglaum Cooperative. This cooperative offers quality services to its members and gives benefits as well. Wholeheartedly the Cooperative accepted her and granted her wishes.

For a year she’s been a member of Paglaum MPC, and she sees that their life simply is getting better. Now she applies a loan of 7,000 php to buy vaccines for her hogs as well as feed for hog-fattening. Through this, she hopes that her children can go to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed & vaccines for hogs

loans.name: Ghulam Bahodin Najrabi Group

texts.en:
Fareema is the group leader of Ghulam Bahodin Najrabi group. They all live in 17th district and each of them would like to take the loan for their own business. The total amount of their group loan is 40,000 Afghani (USD$850) for the term of 8 months.

Fareema wants to take a loan for quilt sewing. Zarmina wants to take a loan for leather sewing. Hasina for sewing clothes and Zarghona for buying materials for her brother’s cart.

They are confident that with the money they receive they can have a good profit and run their business in a good way. They all are happy about the loan process of loan.

loans.use: To improve her quilt sewing business.

loans.name: Homa Sharifa Group

texts.en:
Homa is the group leader of Homa Sharifa group. There are two members in this group. They live in district 10 of Kabul Afghanistan and each of them would like to take a loan for their own business.

Homa wants to take the loan for her husband’s shop to buy leather, thread and so on for sewing shoes. Wahida wants to take a loan for her husband’s hairdressing shop to buy the needed materials. They want to improvetheir business and to have a higher monthly income to support their families in a better way.

loans.use: To buy leather, thread and other materials.

loans.name: Shame Paris Group

texts.en: Razia is the group leader of Shame Paris group. They live in district 4th Kabul Afghnistan and there are four members in this group. The total requested amount is 30000 Afghani for the term of 8 months and each of them would like to receive the loan for her own business. Razia and Mah Jabin want to receive a loan for their tailoring business. Zia Gul wants to take a loan for her quilt sewing business and Jamila wants to take a loan for her business of carpet weaving. They would like to admire this process and want to thank form Kiva too.

loans.use: They would like to admire this process and want to thank form Kiva

loans.name: Abdul Nafee

texts.en:
Abdul nafee is married and he lives with his own family. He has butcher shop and also has land for agriculture. He has been involved in this business for a long time. He got his first loan and used it to further his business. Now he plans to enlarge his business. He wants to take out his second-cycle loan.

Therefore Abdulnafee has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis (USD$1075) with a term of 27 months to enlarge his business, complete his stock and buy some seeds for his land. He would love to be a good business dealer in the future.

Abdulnafee is happy. He plans to open a retail food shop in Jalalabad city in the next five years. He wants to say that without this loan it was impossible to get his business to be its best, and he hopes that it is going to be the best in the future.

loans.use: To complete his stock and enlarge his business.

loans.name: Pisal

texts.en: Mr. Pisal H. is a villager in Kampong Svay village in Kandal province. He is single, lives with his parents, and is a construction worker who contributes a small income to support his family. His neighbor has a piece of land for sale at a very good price. Mr. H. is requesting a loan so he can buy the land and re-sell it for a small profit.

loans.use: To purchase land for re-selling

loans.name: Mrs. Sovanna Tien Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of eleven people and is located in Trapeang Saom village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sovanna T. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. Mrs. Sovanna T. is 29 years old and the mother of two children. The eldest attends school and the youngest is only two. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at better price. Her business is going well, so she is requesting a loan to expand her business and increase her income. Her husband, Mr. Pon Reasmey, is a farmer who owns 2-hectars where he  cultivates rice. 

Two members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The two clients are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To puchase more rice and expand rice business

loans.name: Sothanak

texts.en: Mr. Sothanak C. is a villager in Trapaing Sam village in Takeo province. He is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at a better price. His wife, Mrs. Hing Koy, is a farmer who cultivates rice on a small plot of land. Mr. Sothanak C. is 39 years old and the father of three children who are all attending the local school. His wife is presented in the picture with him. Mr. C. would like to expand his successful rice-selling business and is requesting a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To puchase more rice and expand rice business

loans.name: Savin

texts.en: Mrs. Savin M. was born in 1964 and lives in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who has a small piece of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. Mrs. Savin M. is a widow with two children one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school. The rice revenue she earns from her small plot of land is not enough to sufficiently support her family. She is requesting a loan to help her feed her family during a time of short rice supply.

loans.use: To purchase food for her family

loans.name: Saroeung

texts.en: Mrs. Saroeung M. is a villager in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a small plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Saroeung M. is 35 years old and the mother of five: one works in a garment factory, two are attending the local school, and the remaining two are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Yem Yon, is a palm juice collector who gathers the juice to process into palm sugar or wine. Because her farm does not have a high yield, she is requesting a loan to help with feeding her family during this time of low rice supply. Her husband is pictured with her.

loans.use: To purchase food for her family

loans.name: Nhean

texts.en: Mrs. Nhean P. is a villager in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province. Mrs. Nhean P. is 53 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at a better price.  Her husband, Mr. Roth Sambor, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice. Mrs. Nhean P. is requesting a loan to purchase more stock and expand her business, which will improve her income. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To puchase more rice and expand rice business

loans.name: Ngoem

texts.en: Mrs. Ngoem S. is a farmer in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province. Her husband, Mr. Chhov Moeurn, helps her on the small plantation. They have two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the school. Currently, the rice revenue is too small to support her family and pay for her child's education, so she is requesting a loan to pay for the school fees. Her husband is pictured with her.

loans.use: To pay for school

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom Y. is a villager who lives Angk Prasat village in Takeo province. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock to re-sell later at a better price. Her husband, Mr. Soem Butra, is a farmer who has a small piece of land where he cultivates rice. Mrs. Sokhom Y. is 27 years old and the mother a child who is too young to work or study. Mrs. Sokhom Y. is requesting a loan to expand her rice business and increase her income. Her husband is pictured with her.

loans.use: To puchase more rice and expand rice business

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mr. Keo H. was born in 1962 and lives in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province. He is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock to re-sell later at a better price. He is a widower with three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too small to work or study. Mr. Keo H. is requesting a loan to invest in more rice stock so he can improve his income and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To puchase more rice and expand rice business

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Mrs. Kung H. is a pig breeder in Kbal Damrey village in Takeo province. She is a 44-year-old widow with five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Kung H. is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying ten piglets and pig food. This will improve her income and help her family.

loans.use: To expand pig-raising business

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en: Mr. Saroeun S. was born in 1973 and he now lives with his family in the village called Ro Neam Tnort in the Takeo province. He has five children; four of them attend the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Chorn Touch, is in the photo on the right.  She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She now faces a problem because her field is infertile.  So Mr. Saroeun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to make the crop more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make the rice crop more productive.

loans.name: Liep

texts.en: Mrs. Liep K. lives in the Ro Neam Tnort village in the Takeo province. She is 56 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a farmer while the other three attend the local school. She is a farmer who now faces a problem because her field is infertile.  So she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to make her crops more productive.  Her husband, Mr. Nop Hol, is a duck breeder who can make a little income through this business activity.  He is in the picture on the right.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Borei

texts.en: Mrs. Borei Y. was born in 1979 and she now lives in Ro Neam Tnort village in Takeo province. She has four children who all attend the local school. She is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy 12 piglets for breeding.  She will use the rest of the loan to buy pig food to feed them. Her husband, Mr. Sun Mao, is an ice-cream seller. He is also in the picture.

loans.use: To buy 12 piglets for breeding and to buy pig food to feed them.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhorn M. lives in the Kouk Roka village in the Takeo province. She is 38 years old and the mother of two children who attend the local school. She is a duck breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Uch Bul, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Kai

texts.en: Mr. Kai M. is a duck breeder in the Kouk Roka village in the Takeo province. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it. So he decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Im Moy, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. His wife is presented on the left of the photo. They now live without any children and they hope to increase their income with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Ream

texts.en: Mrs. Ream C. lives in the Wat Svay village in the Takeo province. She is a 51-year-old with four children, one of whom is a farmer while the remaining three attend the local school. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Aside from this plantation, she is also a duck breeder. Since this business is going well, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.use: To buy ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en: Mrs. Lanh S. was born in 1960 and she now lives in the Wat Svay village in the Takeo province. She has six children: four of them are employed in a garment factory, while the others attend the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Phou Sun, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice to earn a living. Although they try to work hard, they still earn only a small income from their rice, not enough to provide a better life for the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Lanh S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income with this new loan. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Mrs. Sophea M. lives in the Svay Ron village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Song Vuthy, is a motorbike taxi driver who can make a small income to support the family. Although they try to work hard they still do not earn enough income to support the family. They also live in an old house in poor condition. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Sophea M. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a better house for her family. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To build a better house for her family.

loans.name: Ney

texts.en: Mrs. Ney K. is a villager in the Trapaing Ta Uy village in the Takeo province. She is 41 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a duck breeder while the others attend the local school. She is also a duck breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more duck food. Her husband, Mr. San Ny, is a construction worker who can make a small income to help support the family. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Mrs. Lorn N. is a pig breeder in Sro Mor village in Takeo province. She is 45 years old and the mother of five children: one is employed in a garment factory, three others are farmers, and the youngest one attends the local school. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy five more piglets for breeding. She will use the rest of the loan to buy pig food. Her husband, Mr. Pak Vet, is a construction worker. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy five more piglets for breeding and more pig food.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom K. is a villager in the Sro Mor village in the Takeo province. She is 40 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom attend the local school while the others are too young to work or study. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She now faces a problem because her field is infertile.  So she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and to buy pesticides to kill the insects. Her husband, Mr. Nak Sovann, helps her on the plantation. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Nom

texts.en: Mrs. Nom N. is a farmer who lives in the Kouk Doung village in the Takeo province. She is a 52-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. She owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Although she works hard, she and her family still live in poor conditions. In order to improve these living conditions, Mrs. Nom N. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding. She hopes to increase her income by selling her cows.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding.

loans.name: Thoeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeung U. is a farmer in Kouk Doung Village in Takeo province. On her plantation she now faces a small problem because the soil in her field is infertile. She decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive. She would also use part of the loan to buy more pesticides to kill all kinds of insects.

Her husband, Mr. Vith Muth, is a garment factory worker who makes a small salary to support the family. Mrs. Thoeung U. is 37 years old and the mother of five children. Four children are attending the local school while the youngest one is less than school-age. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Ngorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngorn O. was born in 1974 and she now lives in Kouk Doung Village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who has a piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. On her plantation she now faces an obstacle because her soil is infertile and it is having a bad effect to her crO.. She decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the field and make her crO. more productive. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more pesticides to kill insects. Her husband, Mr. Phon Roth, is a laborer who makes a small income to support the family.

Mrs. Ngorn O. has four children. Three are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is three years old. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve the soil to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem B. is a villager in Chrouy village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. On her plantation, she is faced with the problem of an infertile field. So, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the soil. She will use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides to kill all kinds of insects.

She is a 58-year-old widow with five children. Two children are masseurs at the Massage Club. Two others are employed in a garment factory and the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve her field.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim N. is farmer in Doeum Rumdeng village in Takeo province. On her plantation, she has the problem of infertile soil, which is having a bad effect on her crop. Thus, Mrs. Kim N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the field and make her crop more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Chun Min, is a firewood seller. Mrs. Kim N. is 39 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị's Group

texts.vi:
Nhóm chị Nguyễn Thị D. (MS : 11 03 0027): thôn Phù Lưu – Trung Nghĩa – Yên Phong – Bắc Ninh. Cả nhóm chị đều vay sang chu kỳ 2
	Chị D., 35 tuổi, là người phụ nữ trẻ năng động, tháo vát, chị vừa làm ruộng, trồng hoa màu, đi chợ buôn bán nhôm, đồng và các loại phế liệu khác. Chồng chị là người thợ xây khéo tay. Tuy cuộc sống còn khá nhiều vất vả nhưng anh chị luôn chăm chỉ, cố gắng làm ăn để có điều kiện tốt nhất cho gia đình, đặc biệt để có thể nuôi dạy 3 con nhỏ ăn học thành đạt. Chu kỳ trước nhóm chị đã vay và hoàn thành rất tốt món vay đó. Chu kỳ này chị tiếp tục vay 2006000đồng/25 tuần/chu kỳ 2 để bổ sung vốn đi chợ buôn bán. Hiện nay thu nhập gia đình chị khoảng 100000 – 150000 đồng / ngày. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm của chị là: 
	Chị Nguyễn Thị N. (MS 11 03 0030) vay 2006000 đồng/ 25 tuần để bổ sung vốn nuôi vịt, làm mộc.
	Chị Nguyễn Thị H. (MS 11 03 0029) vay 1534000 đồng/ 25 tuần để bổ sung vốn mua cám lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị D.’s group lives in Phù Lưu village, Trung Nghĩa commune, Yên Phong district, Bắc Ninh province. The entire group is participating in lending cycle 2. Mrs. D., 35 years old, is a dynamic and resourceful woman. She grows rice and fresh produce, and also buys and sells aluminum, bronze, and other materials at the local market. Her husband is a skilled construction worker. Although they have faced many hardships in life, they have always strived to work hard to provide the best opportunities for their family, especially in raising their three young children to do well in school. In the previous lending cycle, this group of borrowers paid back their loan without any problem. In this lending cycle, Mrs. D. hopes to again borrow 2,006,000 VND (117 USD), to be paid back in 25 weeks, in order to increase her inventory of aluminum, bronze, and other materials. Currently, the total income of the family is about 100,000 - 150,000 VND (6 - 9 USD) per day. The other members in her group are: Mrs. Nguyễn Thị N. hopes to borrow 2,006,000VND (117 USD), to be paid back in 25 weeks, to invest in raising ducks and in her woodworking business. Mrs. Nguyễn Thị H. hopes to borrow 1,534,000VND (91 USD), to be paid back in 25 weeks, to invest in buying mash to feed her pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of aluminum, bronze, and other materials

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị's Group

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị H. (11 03 0026), 35 tuổi, hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ. Gia đình chị ngoài làm ruộng còn trồng lúa, hoa màu còn nuôi rất nhiều gà đẻ trứng. Chu kì trước chị đã vay và hoàn trả rất tốt món vay của mình. Chị rất thích hình thức trả tuần của chương trình nên tiếp tục vay 4704000 đồng/ 50 tuần/ chu kì 2 để bổ sung vốn mua cám nuôi gà đẻ. Gia đình chị thu nhập khá ổn định khoảng 200000 – 250000 đồng/ ngày. 
	Anh Trần
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị H., 35 years old, lives with her husband and two young children.  Her family grows rice and fresh produce, and keeps a large number of laying hens.  In the previous lending cycle, she repaid her loan with no problem.  She is very comfortable with the system of repaying in weekly installments, and hopes to again borrow 4,704,000 VND (275 USD), to be repaid over 50 weeks, to invest in buying feed for her chickens.  The total income of her family is quite stable at about 200,000 - 250,000 VND (12 - 15 USD) per day. 
Mr. Trần

loans.use: Feed for laying hens

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey T., 48, of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia, has been growing rice and vegetable crops in her community for many years, a skill she leaned from her grandparents. She is married with five children, four single and employed, one married. Srey’s husband, Mr. Sheat, 47, is a local construction worker.

One her sons is a motorbike repairer who currently needs money to expand his business. On his behalf, Srey is requesting a loan for the purchase of motorcycle-repair materials.

loans.use: To buy materials for repairing motorcycles.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Mrs. Yun K. is 24 years old and lives in Kompong Cham province where she earns a living as a rice farmer as well as growing vegetable for sell, and began her business since 1990. She is married with one child, whom is teenager and attend school. Her husband, Mr. Preng Yon, is 27 years old. He is a recycles trader who is purchases from villagers by using his motorcycle for transportation, and resell to wholesaler for profit. He currently earns approximately $3 per day to cover his family's living expenses. To grow her husband business for additional income, K. has requested a loan for her husband to use as capital for business to buy more recycles to stock and some part remaining the money to use for cultivating. K.'s husband is pictured in the photo because she was not available.

loans.use: To buy more used goods to resell

loans.name: Achilova

texts.ru: Женщина в возрасте 48 лет, мать пятерых детей.Умри имеет маленький бизнес по продаже продуктов питания.Сама Умри работает кондитером в кулинарном цехе.В рабочие дни на продаже в ларьке торгует её муж.Она кредитуется уже третий год и без проблем погашает свои кредиты. Для увеличения ассортимента товаров она хочет получить очередной займ.Она считает что благодаря кредитам у неё бизнес расширяется.Она с радостью продолжает свою деятельность.
texts.en:
A 48-year-old woman, U. has a small food retail business. In addition, she works as a confectioner at a pastries plant. During the workweek, U.'s business is run by her husband. U. has been a micro-loan borrower for 3 years, and she always pays her loans back without any problems. With this loan U. plans to purchase additional goods to grow her retail business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Shaqaheq Group

texts.en:
A. Mohin is the group leader of Shaqaheq group. There are five members in this group and they all live in district 5 of Kabul Afghanistan. The total amount that the group members want to take is about 50,000 Afghani (USD$1075) and each member wants to take the loan for the progress of his or her business.

A. Mohin wants to take a loan to purchase materials for his retail shop. Samira wants the loan for sewing the clothes. Saheda and Anayta want loans for their husbands' vegetable shop and Jamshed for the purpose of buying car parts for his shop.

They all want to say that the loan will help them go on well and improve their businesses as well.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a retail store.

loans.name: Aiub

texts.ru: Аюв мужчина в возрасте 51 года , отец троих детей.Жена домохозяйка.Сам Аюб работает кассиром в колхозе района Утконсой.С молодости Аюб занимается откормом и продажей скота.На данный момент у него дома  4 коровы и 10 коз.Жена Аюба занимается продажей козьей шерсти.Из-за сезонности Аюб хочет закупить скот.Ему понадобилось 2000 сомони.
texts.en:
Aiub, 51, is married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker and Aiub works as a cashier at a collective farm in Utkonskiy region. Since his youth, Aiub has been raising and selling cattle. At present, he has 4 cows and 10 goats. Aiub's wife sells goat wool. Aiub needs this loan to purchase more cattle.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Mok

texts.en:
A resident of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia, Mrs. Mok T. earns a living growing mushrooms and raising pigs with her husband, earning around $5 per day. The couple currently resides with their two children, both of whom are single, one a local building worker who helps with the family's expenses.

Mok needs to expand her investments and is therefore asking for a loan to buy four piglets to raise and more seeds for mushroom growing.

loans.use: To buy four piglets to raise and more seeds to grow mushrooms.

loans.name: Sayad Abdul Hady

texts.en:
Sayad Abdul Hady lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. His house is near the school of 500 families. He is married with five children and he is 54 years old. He wants a loan for house repairing. 

He has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani for a term of 16 months. He wants to make his house larger and he wants to buy necessary materials for his house.

Sayad Abdul is very happy about this process of microfinance loans. He hopes to continue a partnership with both AFSG and Kiva.

loans.use: To enlarge his house.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng T., of Kompong Cham Province, was born in 1966 and is the mother of six children, all of whom are single. To help meet the family's food needs, two of her children are employed, one as a garment worker in Phnom Penh City and the other as a factory staff member.

Leng, a rice farmer who also owns a rice extraction machine, makes around $6 each day. Her husband, Mr. Phon, 44, works with her in the business. Unfortunately her rice extraction machine is broken, so Leng is requesting a $500 loan to repair it.

loans.use: To repair her rice extraction machine

loans.name: Chu

texts.en:
Chu C., 47, is a local farmer living with seven children, all single, in Kompong Cham Province. Her husband, Sok, 47, works as a carpenter, buying wood to make furniture such as chairs, beds, tables, windows, etc., selling them for a reasonable profit.

Since his business is a very important source of income, Chu is requesting a loan for her husband to purchase additional wood for his enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase wood for her husband's carpentry business

loans.name: Sok Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Ly A. is a villager in Chan village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land used to cultivate rice. On her plantation, she faces some problems because she does not have enough money to hire a laborer with two oxen, and buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crops more productive. In order to solve these problems, she decided to ask for a loan for these purposes.

Her husband, Mr. Kiv Sophal, is a construction worker. Mrs. Sok Ly A. is 30 years old and the mother of three children. Two are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young for studies. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen, and buy fertilizer to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Haseba

texts.en:
Haseba lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a single young girl and she teaches Holy Quran in a course near her house. She wants to add to the number of her teaching classes and to organize some new classes of science there, so she needs an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 16 months.

Haseba is very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand her education classes and to organize new science classes.

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoeun K. lives in Pong Ror village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Phin Phen, are farmers who own a piece of land where they cultivate rice and vegetables. On their plantation they face a problem because they usually pay a lot of money for plowing. In order to reduce her expenses, Mrs. Hoeun K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a second cow to add to the one she currently has to plow the field . She would use the rest of money to hire laborers to work on the field.

She is a 35-year-old mother of three children. One is a farmer who helps on the parents' plantation while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a second cow to plow the field.

loans.name: Pheang

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheang S. lives in Stoeung Penh village in Kampong Cham province. She is a Khmer cake maker who earns a little income to support her household. She has decided to ask for a loan for two purposes. Her husband, Mr. Nut Yim, is a construction worker. With money from the loan she will buy timber for her husband to start a new enterprise as a furniture builder, making beds. She would use the rest of the money to make more cakes and thus expand her own business. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions.

Mrs. Pheang S. is 34 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy timbers to make beds and she would use the rest of money to make more cakes for her business.

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Mrs. Min C. was born in 1950 and she now lives in Neang Toeut village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land used to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In her vegetable farming, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to hire laborers to work on her field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Mrs. Min C. is a widow with four children, three of whom are farmers who help their mother work, while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work on her field.

loans.name: Ran

texts.en: Mr. Ran H. was born in 1947 and he now lives in Neang Toeut village in Kampong Cham province. He and his wife, Mrs. Bun Keat, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate both rice and vegetables. On this plantation, they face a problem because they do not have enough money to hire laborers to work on the field. Thus, Mr. Ran H. decided to request for a loan for this purpose. He has three children, two of whom are farmers who help their parents work and the other is a nurse in the local village. His wife is presented on the right.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. San K. is a villager in Knol village in Kampong Cham province. She is a nurse in the local village. Aside from this career, she is also a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates cassava. On this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to hire laborers to work in the field. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she would use the rest of the loan to buy equipment to take care of the people in her nursing career. Mrs. San K. is a 51-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a laborer and the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work in the field.

loans.name: Payanda Mohammad

texts.en:
Payanda Mohammad lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with four children. He wants to enlarge his business and to complete his stock. For this he needs a loan.

He has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani for the term of 16 months. With it he will buy necessary materials for his shop and expand his business.

He is very happy that he has the opportunity to make a good income and help his family better.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for his shop

loans.name: Sengheun

texts.en: Mrs. Sengheun S. is a 36-year-old widow and she now lives in Knol village in Kampong Cham province. She is a cassava middleman. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more cassava to resell and hire laborers to help her. She hopes to increase her income and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy cassava to resell and hire laborers to help her.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mr. Phon Y. lives in Knol village in Kampong Cham province. He is a beef seller in the local market. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. Therefore he decided to request a loan to buy a cow and sell its meat. His wife, Mrs. Chanthy Sin, is a fruit seller in the local market. Mr. Phon Y. is 50 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is a beef seller who helps in the father's business. The others are enrolled in the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow and sell its meat.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mr. Meur Mean Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people living in the Kampal Village in the Kampong Cham Province comprise this village bank loan; and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Meur M., the 42-year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. He faces a problem with his plantation because his field is infertile which badly affects the crops. In order to deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to improve the field so he can make his crops more productive. His wife, Mrs. C. Oun, helps around his plantation. Mr. Meur M. has four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. 

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. The system allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to make his field and crops more productive

loans.name: Mrs. Chhunheng Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eighteen people living in the Preaek Chan Village in the Kampong Cham Province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. ChhunH. S., the 53-year-old village bank president, is a rice soup seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients to make her delicious rice soup. Her husband, Mr. Sin Seng Hong, is a village chief who doesn't earn enough to support the family. Mrs. ChhunH. S. has seven children, one of whom is a beautician while another is employed in a garment factory. One is a construction worker while another helps with the family business, and the remaining three attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to make rice soup to sell

loans.name: Magatte

texts.fr: Monsieur Magatte D. evolue dans le domaine de l art.IL a une experience de plus de 15 ans dans ce domaine.Il a participe dans differentes foires afircaines.Pour renforcer son son activite il sollicite ce pret.
texts.en:
Mr. Magatte D. is advancing in the art field. He has over fifteen years of experience in it and participates in different African fairs. To bolster his work, he is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boost his working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Mean Cheas Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of ten members is located in the Phnom Touch Village in the Kampong Cham Province, and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Mean C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Yin Yeap, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. They face a problem with their plantation because their field is infertile. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Mean C. decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crops more productive. She is 43 years old and the mother of seven children, four of whom are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study. 

Nine members in this group have end-of-term loans and the other, a monthly payment loan. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. The system allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make the crops more productive

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: Mr. Moeun M. is a villager in the Ro Leak Village in the Kampong Cham Province. He is a director in the local school. Aside from this career, he is also a construction foreman. With this, he faces a small problem because he does not have enough construction supplies for his current job. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy those supplies. He hopes to increase his income and improve the living conditions of his family with this loan. His wife, Mrs. Vorn Un, is a housewife. Mr. Moeun M. is 61 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is a jewelry repairer while the other helps with the family business. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more construction supplies

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en: Mrs. Yeng C. is a villager in the Bantey Thmor Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She faces a problem with the plantation because she usually pays too much money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the fields. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen for plowing in the hopes of reducing her expenses. Her husband, Mr. Ren Doeun, is a village chief and he also helps with the farming. Mrs. Yeng C. is 54 years old and the mother of a construction worker. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the fields

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Azam

texts.en: D. Azam is 33 years old. He is the father of three children who are all in school. Azam also lives with, and cares for his parents, who are old and can not work. He is a high school graduate and decided to start car repair services instead of loitering in cities, looking for jobs that are hard to find. He has also been engaged in a livestock business since 2005  His wife and elder son (pictured) help him with caring for the cows. Azam wants to increase the family income in order to be able to meet his children’s expenses and the health care costs of his parents. He wants to purchase an additional two dairy cows and is requesting a loan of US $ 1050 for the term of 12 months. Azam is a hard working young man and will be able to successfully repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
I. Dilshod is 25 years old and has a secondary school education. He is married with two kids. Dilshod has been buying and selling cattle for five years. Since it's hard to find a job in his region, this business is his main source of income. He plans to use his loan to purchase a few young cattle to fatten and sell. After each cycle he will sell the fattened cattle and acquire more young cattle. Support this young man so that his efforts succeed.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Kholmirzo

texts.en:
Since 2004 K. Kholmirzo has been a livestock farmer. He breeds calves, cows and sheep. He is married and has 2 children whom he needs to support and give a proper education to. Kholmirzo has improved his financial situation because he has been able to wisely use the loans he has received from IMON International to breed his animals. Nowadays, his biggest dream is to expand his business and to also offer animal derivates (as dairy products) in the surroundings of his community. Therefore, his biggest need is to get a loan in order to buy more cows.

loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle

loans.name: Oussama

texts.en: Oussama is a 37-year-old married man with two children, living in Jdita in the Bekaa Valley. He has worked as a taxi driver since 1997, and he usually drives clients who want to be transported between the Bekaa Valley and Beirut. Today, Oussama is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to perform maintenance on his taxi's engine and car body.

loans.use: Perform maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa R. is the mother of 3 children. She is a very honorable and resolute woman. Ever since she was a young girl she learned the honest work of raising cattle, a knowledge she has passed down to her own children who have also managed to improve their quality of life.

Sharifa and her husband started their livestock business with only one cow. After a number of sacrifices they were able to increase little by little the quantity of calves. At the moment, with the support of their children, they have started to produce milk products. They sell these on the weekends in their village. Currently Sharifa wants to expand her business and to purchase more cattle. With the desire of improving their living, Sharifa is counting on your generous heart.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат получает кредит второй раз , она получала кредит для приобретения скота (коров). Ее сыновья собираются в Россию на заработки. Сейчас скот подешевел, поэтому ей не хочется продавать скот, через несколько месяцев скот будет стоить дорого и она продаст по хорошей цене. Она получает деньги на билеты сыновьям, расплачиваться будет продажей молоком и другими кисломолочными изделиями.
texts.en:
This is the second time Sharofat will be receiving a loan. The first time, she needed the money to purchase cows. Now, her sons are leaving to seek work in Russia. The prices for cattle have now decreased, and Sharofat would rather not sell it now, but instead wait a few months, until the prices go up again. This loan will be used to pay for her sons' travel. Sharofat will repay the money using the profits from sales of milk and milk products.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Consumer credit

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 45-year-old married man with three children, living in Taalabaya in the Bekaa Valley. He has been working in installation and maintenance of satellite dishes since 1998. Mahmoud wants to buy cables, for better service and in order to increase his profits; therefore, he is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200.

loans.use: Buy cables

loans.name: Abdumutallim

texts.en:
Abdumutallim T. is a very responsible man. Since his youth, he has raised livestock, specifically cows, on his farm. He is a family man who is very attentive to his children. Since he has been through difficult financial situations, he has fought to provide the education his three young children (one daughter and two sons) deserve. Currently, he lacks the resources to buy more cows. For this reason, he has sought the support of IMON International – to obtain a loan that would allow him to purchase two cows to raise and sell for meat in the region where he lives. With your support, Abdumutallim can achieve his goals.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cows to expand his business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 39-year-old married man with three children, living in Harouf, southern Lebanon. Ali used to work in a shop selling and fixing tires since 1990; three years ago he took a loan from Ameen and opened his own shop. Today, Ali wants to increase his tire inventory; therefore he is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000.

loans.use: Buy more inventory for his shop

loans.name: Izatmo

texts.en:
Izatmo N. is a happily married mother of two adult children. She has a small kiosk where for three years she has been selling office supplies. Her little kiosk is filled with attractive, reasonably priced items that appeal to many customers. She likes what she sells and has developed a stable enterprise. Currently Izatmo has requested a loan in the amount of 400 USD to help her purchase a new supply of items to sell. She promises to repay the loan in 12 months and thanks everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing office supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Djumagul

texts.en:
Djumagul P. is 43 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Djumagul sells office supplies and school supplies. Her shop, located near a school in her village, has a wide range of goods; the majority of her customers are schoolchildren. In comparison with other big stores selling office supplies, Djumagul’s prices are lower and more attractive. Now she is requesting 400 USD for a term of 12 months to purchase office supplies for re-sale.

loans.use: Purchasing office supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Saidamir

texts.en:
Saidamir U. is 49 years old. He is married with 4 children. Four years ago, Saidamir decided to start his own business selling carpets. Saidamir began his business with his hard-earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. He is familiar with this business and provides good customer service. He has many customers, and his business keeps growing. In order to increase the range of carpets he has on offer, he now needs a loan in the amount of 2000 Somoni which he will use to purchase more inventory. He commits to repaying this amount within 11 months. Be a part of this business and of Saidamir's family by supporting his growing business. They greatly appreciate it!

loans.use: Increasing of the range of carpets in his inventory

loans.name: Myhayo

texts.ru: Наимова Мухайё закончив свой кредит хочет получить следующий займ.После первого кредита у неё ассортимент заметно увеличился.Для поддержки бизнеса ей понадобилось 2000 сомони.Она арендует небольшой магазинчик.Её торговля в разгаре , т.к. ей точка продажи расположена в центре рынка.
texts.en:
Myhayo N. just paid off a loan and would like to receive another one. She rents a small store in the center of a local market, and the business is going very well. Myhayo used the previous loan to increase assortment of the goods and she needs this loan to sustain the business growth.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sustain business growth

loans.name: Rustamchon

texts.ru: Рустамчон парень в возрасте 25 лет , женат имеет одну маленькую дочку, жена занимается уходом за ребёнком.Сам Рустамчон уже 7 лет как занимается купля продажей фруктов по сезону.На данный момент он продаёт яблоки и мандарины.Для увеличения своего бизнеса он решил взять кредит.Для этого он обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Rustamchon, 25, married, and has a daughter. His wife takes care of the child. For 7 years, Rustamchon has been selling fruits. At present, he sells apples and mandarins. Rustamchon applied for this loan to finance expansion of his business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Ёкубова Санавбар 1960 года рождения, у нее 4 детей. Старший сын помогает  торговать на  рынке, он заменяет в ее отсутствии. Она торгует конфетами и  печеньями. Ей необходимо было расширить свой бизнес перед новым годом,ее соседка по бизнесу кредитуется в Микроинвесте, она наблюдала за развитием ее бизнеса и решила также получить кредит в Микроинвесте. Сейчас Санавбар погасит последний свой кредит и планирует получит новый займ для расширения торговой точки и  увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en:
Sanavbar Y., 49, has 4 children. Her oldest son helps Sanavbar with her business. Sanavbar sells candies and cookies at a local market. She is completing paying off her previous loan and wants to take a new one to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Мuazzam

texts.ru: Косимова Муаззам пунктуально закончив свой кредит , в сезон решила опять получить кредит.Она в неделю раз ездит за товаром в Истаравшан, для увеличения ассортимента товаров она подала заявку на займ.В её отсутствии на рынке сидит её дочка.Муаззам пунктуальная женщина, бывшая учительница средней школы.Т.к заработная плата учителей мизерная,она перестала работать ,и занимается бизнесом.
texts.en:
After repaying her last loan on time, Мuazzam K. has decided it is time to take out another. Once a week she travels to Istaravshan for goods, and she has applied for this loan in order to increase her inventory. Her daughter fills in for her at the market in her absence. Muazzam is a punctual woman, a former middle school teacher. Since a teacher's salary is so paltry, she quit her job and went into business for herself.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Women's clothing

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia G. was having a great time with her business, which is pig distribution, until the something came that she never expected to happen. Her husband was paralyzed, and she could get no more assistance from him, her partner in the business. Dionesia has 3 children who are in school. Dionesia and her family is recently residing at Dumagoc, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur Province. 


Dionesia is now having a hard time dealing with the present situation. But Dionesia is still determined to continue the kind of business that she has now. “It is the only way to survive the trial now,” said Dionesia. Dionesia is looking forward to a bigger income, an expansion that she plans. She needed 14,000 php to start what she wanted to do. And the reason for all this is she doing it is for her family, for her husband and for her children in their education.

loans.use: for expanding the pig-distribution business

location.town: Dumagoc, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Ms. Rebecca G. is one of those people who wanted to prove that being a widow with perseverance and determination, you can achieve dreams. She presently resides at Balangasan District, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del Sur. Despite being a single parent, she was able to send her 3 children to school. The eldest was a volunteer nurse at the Ameliorant Hospital. The second child recently got her degree at Information Technology at STI. Her youngest is a graduating student in high school this coming March. These are the reasons why she strives hard, because she wanted to give her 3 children with a better, brighter future and a proper education.

Her primary business is a carenderia located in front of their house only. She cooks early in the morning. Her business is really accessible by the customer in the since it is near at the welding shop, and many people pass by with her area. Her existing capital will not able meet the demand of the customers. With the help of Paglaum Co-op at the PDP-LP (microfinance) program, she was able to expand her carenderia and gain profits on it. Recently she’s now at the 4th cycle and she able to maintain her MIGS or Member in Good Standing at the co-op. 

This member is full of spirit, determination and dedication with her work helping her family.
