She always says thank you so much to the Paglaum Co-op for being part of their lives in fulfilling their dreams. For us, we believe that the Paglaum Co-op is always here to help those people who want to help themselves also.

loans.use: expansion of foodstand/carenderia

location.town: Balangasan District, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Rechelle

texts.en:
Rechelle B. (the lady in white) is 31 years old and presently residing in Buenavista District, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del Sur. She has 2 kids and her husband is a mechanic. Her eldest child is 11 years old, and her youngest is a 1-year-old girl. They've been married for 12 years, and through the years they've struggled and lived happily but full of dreams and hopes that someday they will own a restaurant with 12 employees so that they can help their neighbors who have no income or work.

She started a hanging rice business, through the encouragement of her sister-in-law, for income. She can make 100 and sell them to carenderias in the city. Hanging rice is composed of the leaves of the coconut tree and rice, and she supplies 2 carenderias daily with 300 pieces of cooked hanging rice, and also gets occasional orders, like for fiesta celebrations of the city, municipal activities, Christmas, Valentines Day and other celebrations.

Through the loan and skills assistance of Paglaum Cooperative, she applied for a loan worth Php 10,000.00, and expanded her hanging rice business. She started to look around for a potential area for display. She was inspired to start a carenderia for more income, as a stepping stone to achieve her dream, which included owning a restaurant. In this way she can give jobs to unemployed neighbors, and most of all, she provide for the needs of her 2 kids. Hopefully her husband can have a welding shop, too.  With her determination and guidance, nothing is impossible.

loans.use: for expansion of her hanging rice business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Barangay Unidos, is one of the areas where Paglaum MPC is reaching out to. Barangay Unidos is in the municipality of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental Province, Philippines. Liza B. is a resident in such a place. Liza is 42 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. One is at school and the other is still in the crib. 

Liza wanted to help her husband make money every day for them to be able to have 3 meals a day. So Liza decided to do dressmaking since she has the ability to do it. But how could she make dress if there was no sewing machine, threads and other things needed for the dress making? Liza is getting an amount of 20,000 php to purchase all of these things for her to sewing and to start building her dream for her children and her family.

loans.use: for dressmaking/sewing

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en:
Meraluna C. is in the hog fattening business. Meraluna is 32 years old, married and blessed with one child. Meraluna and family live in Barangay Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 


Meraluna started the business with just 2 piglets and a small amount of money.  It has been a lot of hard work and she doesn’t underestimate the kind of work it will take to maintain it. In order to maintain her business, Meraluna realized that she needs additional capital. She would like to borrow $450 to purchase all the stuff she needs. 


From the income that she will gain, Meraluna will be pay her loan of course and like any other parent, provide her children a good and bright future.

loans.use: additional capital for raising hogs

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley J. is 50 years old, married, and lives in Obay, Polanco Zamboamga del Norte. She has 4 children and 2 are in school. One of them is graduating this coming March. According to her, their life’s journey has been full of challenges.  Her husband works hard as a carpenter, sewer and driver so that he could give the best of things for his family but still it is not enough. To help out, Shirley began selling snacks at school.

Hearing about Paglaum MPC, she joined on May 17, 2006.  Shirley stopped selling snacks in the school and used her first loan was used to open a sari-sari store on their house.  She sells firewood and even fruits in her store. Recently, she asked for a $325 loan to buy merchandise for the sari-sari store & to repair their tricycle for her husband’s income. She hopes for the progress and success of her business so that they could raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for sale & to repair their motorcycle for hire

loans.name: Rosamie

texts.en: Mrs. Rosamie A. is 19 years old, married and a resident of Danao Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.  Her husband is a fisherman.  Since she married at an early age, she had to help her husband with his business.  He catches fish to be sold to the public market or neighbors. They have been on this business for a year, and they decided to acquire additional fishing boats and fishing nets. They agreed to join Paglaum MPC last July 31, 2007, where they have used the financial services and other benefits such as insurance and savings deposit.  They request a loan for $325.  She hopes that their business will be successful so they can send their child to school.

loans.use: To acquire a fishing boat

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Ginger is known to be a great help to humankind. It is commonly used as an ingredient in food, a sore throat reliever and sometimes we believe it will make us a better singer. Fe E. and family have a Ginger Powder making business.

Fe E.’s house is situated at Sibucao, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur Province. Special Instant Salabat is what they call for their product. Fe started the business with an initial capital of PHP 500. Her husband is her partner in the business and usually does the mixture of the product. 

In preparation of their daughter’s education, they would like to earn more and thus want to expand their business. So, they ask for a loan of PHP 8,500 as an additional capital for their business expansion.

loans.use: additional capital for ginger powder making

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Ms Yolanda A.( the lady in the left) is 49 years old, married to a carpenter and has 3 children.  Ms A. is from Balangasan Dist. Pagadian City, a province of Zamboanga del Sur.  She is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative Pagadian Branch and is now on her 4th loan.  She has requested additional capital of her existing RTW business, payable for ten months in a weekly basis. According to Ms. A. it has been a dream come true to her family to be part of PMPC and have her own business as another source of income to her family.  It has been a big help for them to send their children to school. 

RTW business and PMPC has been their inspiration in building a happy home with the guidance of our Almighty Father.

loans.use: additional capital for RTW business expansion

location.town: Balangasan District, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan A. lives in Barangay Usocan, Plaridel City, Misamis Occidental province, Philippines, and is married at the age of 23 and blessed with 1 child. 

Joan cannot find a job right now; for a meanwhile, she is vending “tempura”. Tempura is all time Filipino favorite street food. It is fried flour and has a meaty like taste. This is also a way to help her husband, who is a fisherman, to generate money. They earn money so that they can sustain their child, who is an infant.

Joan believes all the things that she needs could be accommodated by a $75 loan. “Life isn’t easy” Joan says, “but you could not reach the top unless you take the first step".  $75 would go a long way in making her dreams possible.

loans.use: additonal capital for tempura vending

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn S. lives in Barangay Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Evelyn is 44 years old, married and has 4 children. One of their children was able to graduate college and find a job in a department store at Cebu City, which fulfilled their dreams.

Evelyn and husband still strive hard and struggle because they have 3 more children who haven’t finished school yet. But Evelyn stay positive. “It’s a matter how you deal with the situation” she said. Evelyn thought of fishing to raise money, as it is acommon and usual source of income of most people in their barangay. She needs PHP 15,000 to purchase a new fishing boat. Her husband will fish while Evelyn will take care of their children. The amount that they request could be a great help for them to achieve their dream.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida S. (the woman in the left) has a junk shop. Florida is a resident of Santo Nino District, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur Province. She is married and blessed with 3 children. All of her children is at school while her husband also runs the junk shop. 

Florida and her husband are looking to expand their shop and to have a wholesale business in the future. They want everything to be financially secure as the need of their family increase, especially with the education of their children. An amount of PHP 10,000 is all they need for such project and they ask for help in fulfilling their dreams.

loans.use: addtional capital for junk shop business expansion

location.town: Purok Ferdinand, Santo Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboa

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa C. is 59 years old, happily married, and currently living at Purok Bayong, Antipolo Dapitan City. Her husband is a farmer and they have four children and only one is in school. Their main source of income is their small rice field. However it tends to be difficult for them to buy fertilizers after paying the wages they give to their helpers in the field. Gaudiosa wants to start a new project, a sari-sari store business. She decided to join a Cooperative and chose Paglaum MPC on March 26, 2006.

Her first loan 3,000 PHP was used to buy fertilizers. She bought pigs when her loan was increased to larger amounts. The income from their fields and from her pigs helped pay for her children's studies. She sees an improvement in her life with the loans from Paglaum. Now, she requests a 14,900PHP loan to buy merchandise for her sari-sari (small grocery store). She wants to make her new business a success and increase their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma O. is 43 years old, married, and lives at Obay, Polanco Zamboanga del Norte. She has 2 children and both are in school. A mother always dreams for a better future of her children so she works diligently to earn an income. She is a bookkeeper of their barangay and her husband is a mason.
 
Emma has been a member of  Paglaum MPC since May 17, 2006. She used her first loan to be a RTW dealer. She buys stock, and sells to her nearest neighbors. Her profit is very helpful for her family's daily needs, as well as school fees. Now, she requests a $325 loan because she wants to have additional capital for her to buy new stocks of RTW’s. She hopes to create a better and more comfortable life with the help of Paglaum and the profit she earns from her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of RTW for sale

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida J. is 27 years old, married, and lives at Owaon, Dapitan City. She is blessed with one child. At her young age, she wants to prepare abetter future of her only child as well as for her husband who is a farmer.

She joined Paglaum MPC because she wanted to save and use the other financial services that the Cooperative offers. Later, she realized that she wanted to help her family so she applied for a loan of 3,000 PHP to raise hogs. She found out this was a good business, and she can make money from it but her capital is insufficient. She applies for a 7,000PHP loan to buy pig fattening materials & feed. 

This business has been an achievement for her because she is able to expand her business on her own with the help of Paglaum MPC. She wants to own many high breed pigs someday. She also wishes that her child will be proud of her when she gets older.

loans.use: To buy pig fattening materials & feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional capital for watch repair

loans.name: Cécilia

texts.fr: Cécilia Basséne est une jeune mére de famille qui vit avec ses deux petits enfants. Son mari ne travaille plus. C'est par la vente de vin local que cette dame parvient à régler les besoins sociaux au jour le jour. Son commerce de vin de palme date de plus de deux ans et se fait dans son domicile. Elle voudrait bénéficier de moyens supplémentaires afin que son activité soit plus lucrative et ainsi elle pourra mieux aider sa famille.
texts.en:
Cécilia Basséne is a young mother living with her two small children. Her husband doesn't work anymore. She manages to deal with daily basic needs through the sale of local wine. Her palm wine business has been operating for more than 2 years and takes place at her house. She would like to get more resources to make her business more lucrative so she can be of more assistance to her family.

Translated from French by anne-laure behaghel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: production and sale of local palm wine

loans.name: Wuildon

texts.es:
Wuildon  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Además trabaja como comerciante vendiendo comida rápida en su kiosco ubicado al lado de la Normal Superior de profesores que se encuentra en su comunidad
 
Vive. en la comunidad Cota Cota,  localidad de Pucarani,  Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa quien le colabora en la producción de leche  y su hogar que consta de 2 hijos. 
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Wuildon dedicates himself to raising cattle, whose milk he then sells to PIL Andina (the Andean Industrial Plant of Milk). In addition, he works selling fast food from his kiosk next to the Teacher Training College located in his community. He lives in the Cota Cota community of the Los Andes province, located four hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife, who works with him in the production of milk and caring for their home which consists of 2 children. The loan would be destined to purchase a milking cow so he can increase his production and, therefore, his earnings. This is his first credit with Impro, and the evaluation conducted qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow to increase his production of milk.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El Banco Virgen del Carmen inicia su 17 ciclo con  19 socias, las socias son del distrito D. Pacaycasa que se ubica a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como fabricación D. ladrillos, ventas D. animales, abarrotes en general, frutas, cochinilla, tuna, tara y cosméticos. 

Como es el caso D. Zosima es casada, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Zosima junto a su esposo compran y venden ganados que compran en las diferentes ferias y pueblos, luego los comercializan en la feria D. San Juan, Zosima necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en al compra D. ovejas. 

Por otro lado Petronila es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Petronila junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación D. ladrillos artesanales, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad. Además Petronila en época D. producción D. Tuna lleva esta fruta a la ciudad D. Lima.

Mientras que Francisca es casada, tiene 60 años y 7 hijos, Francisca viaja  a los diferentes pueblos en donD. compra cuy, gallina que luego comercializa en los restaurantes. Además Francisca cosecha tara que venD. a intermediarios.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total D. 13,250 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. oveja, arena, cuy, gallina, azucar, arroz, fideos, animales menores, tara, tuna y pago D. peones.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener capital propio, brindar una buena educación alimentación a sus hijos, sacar adelante su negocios y vivir bien con su familia.
texts.en:
The bank Virgen del Carmen begins its 17th cycle with 19 members. The associates are from the district of Pacaycasa, located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. The members have different businesses such as the production of bricks, animal sales, general groceries, fruit, cochineal insects, Tuna (a form of cactus), tara powder and cosmetics. In the case of Zosima; she is 39 years old, married and has 2 children. Zosima and her husband buy and sell livestock, they buy it in the various fairs and towns and then sell in the San Juan fair. Zosima needs a loan of 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of sheep. On the other hand, Petronila is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. Petronila and her husband make a living manufacturing handcrafted bricks, and sell them in their community. Additionally, Petronila during Tuna cactus season, takes this fruit to the city of Lima. In the meantime Francisca is 60 years old, married with 7 children. Francisca travels to the different towns where she buys guinea pigs and chickens that she later sells to restaurants. Also, Francisca grows tara, which she sell to intermediaries. The partners need different loan amounts such as 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles 1000 soles, totaling to a loan of 13,250 soles in the Community Bank. Their loan proceeds will be invested in the purchase of sheep, sand, guinea pigs, chickens, sugar, rice, noodles, small animals, tara, tuna and pay to the workers. The dreams of the members are to have their own capital, proviD. a good education and good nutrition for their children, grow their businesses and live well with their families.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sheep, sand, guinea pigs, chickens, sugar, rice, noodles, small animals, tara, tuna and pay for the workers.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Minka que significa Ayuda en quechua.
Martha es separada, tiene 46 años y 5 hijos, Martha se dedica a la venta D. golosinas D. manera ambulatoria en el puente enace. Además Martha venD. cebiche actividad que realiza por las mañanas.
Martha necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. frutas y golosinas.
Martha sueña con tener una bodega en su casa y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the community bank Minka, which means "help" in Quechua. Martha is 46 years old, separated and has 5 children. Martha makes a living selling candy as a street vendor on the Enace bridge. Martha also sells cebiche, a local raw fish dish, in the mornings. Martha needs a loan of 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of fruit and candies. Martha dreams of having a general store in her home and being able to improve her residence.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of fruit and candies.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia es socia del Banco Comunal Minka que significa Ayuda en quechua.
Zenobia es soltera, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Zenobia tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, golosinas, también prepara gelatinas y chupetes. Además viaja a las ferias cada 15 días en donde vende hoja de coca y de la feria compra cereales.
Zenobia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza, gaseosa, arroz.
Los sueños de Zenobia son tener un carro para que trabaje su hijos y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Zenobia is a member of the community bank Minka, which means "help" in quechua. Zenobia is single, 38 years old and has 3 children. Zenobia has a general store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, meats, candies and also makes gelatin and lollipops. She also travels to the fairs every 15 days where she sells coca leaves and buys grains. Zenobia needs a loan of 2000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of beer, soft drinks, and rice. The dreams of Zenobia are to have a car so that her children could work and improve her residence.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of beer, soft drinks and rice.

loans.name: Maximo Mamerto

texts.es:
Máximo es socio del Banco Comunal Minka que significa Ayuda en quechua.
Máximo es casado, tiene 57 años y 3 hijos, Máximo es panificador, elabora panes típicos llamados chaplas, actividad que realiza junto a su esposa, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado magdalena por las noches.
Máximo necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, azúcar.
Máximo sueña con tener una tienda en su casa e implementar con todas las maquinas necesarias su panadería.
texts.en:
Máximo is a member of the Communal Bank Minka, which means ‘help’ in Quechua. Máximo is married, is 57 years old, and has 3 children. Máximo is a baker, and makes traditional breads called Chaplas, an activity that he carries out with his wife. Their goods are sold in the Magdalena market by night. Maximo needs a loan of 1,600 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of flour and sugar. Maximo dreams of having a store in his home in which he can set up with all the necessary machinery for his bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour and sugar.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith es socia del Banco Comunal Minka que significa Ayuda en quechua.
Edith es separada, tiene 32 años y 5 hijos, Edith se dedica a la venta de cocinas, ollas a presión, licuadoras que vende a crédito, en los últimos meses implemento una tienda de abarrotes en su casa en donde también vende sus otros productos.
Edith necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cocinas, licuadoras.
Los sueños de Edith es construir su casa con material noble y seguir mejorando sus negocios.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of the Communal Bank Minka, which means ‘help’ in Quechua. Edith is separated, is 32 years old, and has 5 children. Edith sells kitchenware such as pressure cookers and blenders, which she sells on credit. The past few months she established a grocery store in her home where she also sells her other products. Edith needs a loan of 1,200 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of kitchenware and blenders. Edith’s dreams are to build her home with high-quality materials, and to continue improving her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase kitchenware and blenders.

loans.name: La Solucion Ii Group

texts.en:
Group 2 from La Solucion (The Solution) Bank of Hope is located in La Barquita, a very impoverished community in Sabana Perdida, on the northern outskirts of Santo Domingo. The members are very excited about the opportunities this first loan could provide for their businesses, which include lingerie, vegetable, and clothing sales. They all dream of improving their economic conditions, hoping to provide better lives for their children (the five are mothers), and eventually moving into houses in a better area of the city.

One of the group members, Julissa, who will start a shoe-selling business with this loan, stated in the meeting that she has set herself the goal of having her own car in two years. She said to the loan officer: “When I have my car, I will come here to this office and take you for a ride.”

These ladies are determined to progress through hard work. Let`s help their dreams come true. Thank you for supporting this loan!

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to start a shoe-selling business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria G. is thirty-five years old. She is a wife and mother of three children, all in primary school. She lives at Bawalashie community, a suburb of Accra, Ghana. She is a trader and sells groceries like toiletries, soaps, candies, biscuits, and soft drinks. She has been in this business for the past three years.

As a mother, Victoria works hard to support her husband in taking care of their children. Her husband is a taxi driver and they both work hard to sustain the family. She buys the groceries from Accra central market. She also orders the drinks directly from the manufacturers in Accra at wholesale prices. She operates her business in a kiosk in front of her rented apartment.

With this loan, she wants to purchase groceries and drinks in bulk to avoid the price hikes that constantly reduce her profit. She believes the loan funds would enable her to improve her income and save more to support her family, especially her kids’ education.

loans.use: To buy groceries and drinks in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Yola America

texts.es:
Yola es socia del Banco Comunal Minka que significa Ayuda en quechua.
Yola es casada, tiene 56 años y 3 hijos, Yola tiene una fuente de soda llamada Yoli, la especialidad son las hamburguesas, esta ubicado en una avenida bastante concurrida de la ciudad, actividad que realiza por las tardes y noches con la ayuda de 6 empleados.
Yola necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hamburguesas y papas.
El sueño de Yola es ampliar su negocio y tener una sucursal en otra calle céntrica de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Yola is a member of the Communal Bank "Minka", which means "help" in quechua. Yola, 56, is married and has three children. She has a small cafeteria called "Yoli"; her specialty are hamburguers. The cafeteria is located in a very busy street, and it opens every afternoon. She employs 6 people. Yola needs a loan of 1,000 soles, to purchase more beef and potatoes. Ultimately, her dream is to expand her business and open another cafeteria in another area of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ground beef and potatoes

loans.name: Fidenciano Candelario

texts.es:
Fidenciano es socio del Banco Comunal Minka que significa Ayuda en quechua.
Fidenciano es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 1 hijo, Fidenciano junto a su esposa se dedican a la venta de helados de manera ambulatoria en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Fidenciano vende ropa en las ferias de la región.
Fidenciano necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de helados, chompas, casacas.
Los sueños de Fidenciano son tener un puesto estable en uno de los mercados de la ciudad y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fidenciano is a member of the Community Bank Minka, a Quechua Word for “Help”. Fidenciano lives with his wife. He is 40 years old and has a son. He and his wife sell ice cream on the streets of the city of Ayacucho. He also sells clothes at the local fairs. Fidenciano needs a loan of 1400 soles, which he will use to purchase ice cream, sweaters and jerseys. Fidenciano’s dream is to have a fixed location for him business at one of the city markets

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ice cream, sweaters and jerseys

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort B. is forty-five years old. She resides at Bawalashie with her husband and four kids, all in school. She sells kenkey, fish, vegetables, yam, and plantain at the Mmepeasem market, a small community at Bawalashie. Kenkey is a local dish prepared from milled maize and mostly served with grind hot pepper and fish. Comfort has been in this business for the past twelve years, a trade she learned from her late mother. She buys ingredients from Madina market to cook her kenkey and then sells in her community. She has a plot and hopes to build her own house and move in with her family. She will use this loan to buy maize.

loans.use: To buy maize to make kenkey.

loans.name: Atta

texts.en: O. Atta is thirty-two years old. He is married with a child who is currently in school. He is an experienced taxi driver and also operates in a provision store. He has been in business for seven years. Due to his hard work, a lot of people buy from his shop. He sells items like milk, Milo, sugar, and soap. He sells these items in a shed and deems it an opportunity to get his own store. He wants to use this loan to buy more bags of rice, sugar, cartons of milk, and Milo. He procures his goods from big shops in town at wholesale prices. He hopes to increase his income to support his child’s education.

loans.use: To buy provisions to sell in his store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Elena es casada, tiene 68 años y 4 hijos, Elena junto a su esposo viajan a las diferentes ferias D. L. región en donD. venD. ropa variada para todas las edades, pero en los últimos meses Elena no esta viajando porque L. operaron y tiene que descansar. Además Elena tiene 2 carros con el cual trabajan sus hijos.
Elena necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. chompas, faldas, mandiles, pantalones.
Elena sueña con tener una tienda D. ropa y vender al por mayor, mejorar su salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Community Bank Ollantay. Elena is married. She is 68 years old and has 4 children. She and her husband travel to different fairs of the area to sell clothes for all ages. However, some months ago she had surgery and hasn’t been able to work as she needed to rest. She also has 2 vehicles that are used by her children to work. Elena needs a 3000 soles loan, which she will use to purchase, jerseys, skirts, aprons and pants. Elena’s dream is to own a clothes’ shop and sell wholesale products. She also wants get better to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase, jerseys, skirts, aprons and pants.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Catalina es casada, tiene 49 años y 9 hijos, Catalina viaja a las ferias y pueblos de donde compra cereales, quesos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho, también vende flores de manera ambulatoria. Además en temporadas vende tuna al por mayor y menor.
Catalina necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tuna por cajas.
Los sueños de Catalina son mejorar su casa, cultivar papa en sus tierras y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Catalina is a member of the Community Bank Ollantay. Catalina is married. She is 49 years old and has 9 children. She goes to fairs in different towns to purchase cereal, cheese, to later on sell them at the markets of the city of Ayacucho. She also sells flowers on the streets of the city. During prickly pear season, she sells this product as a retailer. Catalina needs a 750 soles loan, which she will use to purchase prickly pears in boxes. Catalina’s dream is to make home improvements, farm potatoes and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase prickly pears in boxes

loans.name: El Gran Esfuerzo 3 Group

texts.en:
Johanny V. is a group coordinator for the "El Gran Esfuerzo" (The Great Effort) Bank of Hope in Hato Mayor.  She has no children. She does not have any formal education either. The "El Gran Esfuerzo" bank members are receiving their 6th loan.  Johanny will be using her loan to buy clothes and other items for her business. 

Johanny's micro business is clothing sales. Previous to taking out microloans, these entrepreneurs could not run their own sustainable bussinesses. The group members did not see much of a future in other employment activities, and agreed that working for themselves shows much more promise and profit. 

In the future, Johanny mentions that she would like to grow her business, and improve her house with cement block installation.  She would also like to have a place to set up her own clothing store. 

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for her clothing business

loans.name: Rosa Teodosia

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Rosa es casada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Rosa tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde vende artesanía como telares, tejidos que manda a elaborar, también vende en su casa a clientes ya fijos.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tapices, pasadizos.
Los sueños de Rosa son mejorar su negocio, vender sus productos en el extranjero y tener capital suficiente.
texts.en:
Rosa is a partner of the "Banco Comunal Ollantay" (a bank). Rosa is married, is 50 years old and has 4 children. Rosa has a stand in the central market of the city of Ayacucho, where she sells woven handicrafts. She also sells decorated fabrics to established customers from her home. Rosa needs a loan of 1500 soles (Peruvian monetary unit) that will be invested in the purchase of tapestries and passageways. Rosa's dream is to improve her business, sell her products abroad and have sufficient capital.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tapestries, passageways

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Olga es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Olga viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra cereales, queso, papa. Además Olga trabaja en la cocina de un programa social del cual recibe una propina.
Olga necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de plátanos, naranja, uva.
Los sueños de Olga son construir su casa, comprar una moto y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Ollantay Community Bank. She lives with her partner, is 30 years old, and has 3 children. Olga travels to the various markets in the region where she sells fruit and buys cereals, cheese, and potatoes. She also works in the kitchen of a social program from which she receives a tip. Olga needs a loan of 1050 soles which will be invested in the purchase of bananas, oranges, and grapes. Her dreams are to build a house, buy a motorcycle, and make sure that her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bananas, oranges, and grapes for resale

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señorita Marina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del río blanco” comunidad Chipana, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento de Puno; de  26 años de edad, estado civil soltera, no tiene hijo, posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja desde tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio compra y venta de quesos, chuño, maíz y otros; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para acopiar quesos y comercializarlos en los mercados de Tacna e Ilave.
Ella desea mejorar su negocio de quesos, y quiere llevar este producto a otros mercados (Cuzco y Arequipa), con este préstamo de  S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles podrá comprar mayor cantidad de quesos asimismo ella desea comprar mas chuño negro y blanco; de esta manera piensa obtener mas ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar, finalmente se compromete a pagar puntualmente su  préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the communal bank "Las Brisas del Rio Blanco" located in the Chipana community, Pilcuyo district, Del Collao province, Puno department. She is single, 26 years old and has a son. Marina finished grammar school. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. She has a business buying and selling cheeses, dried potatoes, corn and other products. Her first loan was in the amount of $100 which she used to purchase and sell cheeses in the markets of Tacna. Marina wants to improve her business and wants to take her cheeses to other markets (Cuzco and Arequipa). With this loan of $950 she will be able to purchase a greater quantity of cheeses as well as dried potatoes. This will allow her to obtain more income so that she can improve the quality of life in her home. Finally, she promises to pay her loan in five monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a greater quantity of cheese and dried potatoes.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is member of Cornerstone Group. She is forty-three years old and married with two kids, both of whom are in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a suburb of the capital city, Accra.

Felicia is a resourceful woman who owns a cold store and trades in charcoal and soft drinks, such as Fanta and Coke. She buys from Tema. Due to limited working capital, she is not able to buy much. She is requesting a loan to buy more stock and deep freezers. She buys from wholesalers in her community and has been in business for eight years now. She hopes to raise more income to support her family, especially her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Cucerova

texts.en: Ms. I. lives in the town of Vulcanesti.  She used to live with her siblings in a village of Vulvanesti town, where she always had to help her parents in the household chores. When she moved to her current residence, she works by herself. She buys fruits and vegetables in Chisinau and sells them  in the wholesale market in Vulvanesti. Her two-year old business is profitable because of steady demand for food products.  She is asking for a loan from MicroInvest, for the first time, to increase the stock of her goods.

loans.use: To increase the stock of goods for her fruit and vegetable selling business

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco”, en el sector cuatro, comunidad de Sucano, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 36 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, y es madre soltera y posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (cuarto de secundaria).
Trabaja hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos e inicio su negocio de compra y venta de ganado (ovino, vacuno y porcinos), su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra de mas ganado para poder engordarlo y venderlo.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, monto que destinará a la compra de mas ganado (ovinos, porcinos y vacunos) ya que ella posee pastos cultivados y es mas fácil engordar ganado, su ganado lo vende en pie en la ferias ganaderas de Pilcuyo y en carne en los mercados de Ilave y Puno.  De esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la calidad educativa de sus hijos; asimismo se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of "Las Brisas del Río Blanco" Communal Bank located in sector four of the Sucano community of the Pilcuyo district in El Collao province in the state of Puno. She's 36 years old, has three children, is a single mother and has an incomplete secondary school education (equivalent of the 10th grade). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years and started her business buying and selling cattle, sheep and pigs. Her first loan was for 300 soles that she invested in the purchase of more cattle that she could fatten and sell. With this loan of 1,500 soles she will buy cattle, sheep and pigs because she already owns the pasture land and it's easier to raise them. She will sell her animals in the fairs of Pilcuyo and the meat in the markets of Puno. In this way she will contribute to the quality of education of her children. She promises to pay back the loan on time in five monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle, sheep and pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha D. is thirty–five years old. She is married with three children, two sons and one daughter. Her first son is married and living outside the family home. Her other two children are in school. She operates a “chop bar” (restaurant), where she sells local dishes such as fufu, which is prepared from cooked pounded cassava and plantain, banku, made from milled maize and cassava, and rice balls. These dishes are mostly served hot with soups.

Martha says the cost of raw materials has gone up and that she needs a loan to enable her to meet production costs. She wants to purchase raw materials like cassava, plantain, rice, vegetables, and maize to prepare her meals. She wants to work harder to save enough money to help sponsor her children to higher levels.

loans.use: To procure foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Yusmery

texts.es:
La señora Yusmery es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” de la Provincia Juli, Departamento de Puno; de  25 años de edad, es conviviente, con un solo hijos, posee estudio superior incompleta (trabajo social).
Trabaja desde hace tres años y seis meses, con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la artesanía; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para comprar materiales para su  artesanía como lana (lana sintética, bayetas y otros).
Ella piensa mejorar su negocio de artesanía, ella desea tener una tienda de ropas para bebes, con este préstamo de  S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles para comprar más materiales para su artesanía(lana sintética  de distintos colores y bayetas, napa, lentejuelas, telas y otros), todo ello lo hace para obtener mas ingresos económicos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y asimismo desea terminar su estudio superior, finalmente se compromete a pagar puntualmente su  préstamo en seis cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Yusmery is a member of "La Juleñita" Communal Bank located in the province of Juli in the state of Puno. She is 25 years old, has a common-law husband, one child and an incomplete education (she has completed some courses in social work). She has worked for three years and six months with the Manuela Ramos Movement and maks handicrafts. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase materials for her handicrafts like wool (synthetic wool, flannel cloth and others). She wants to improve her handicraft business and her desire is to have a store where she can sell clothing for babies. With this loan of 1,200 soles, she will purchase materials for her handicrafts (synthetic wool in different colors, flannel cloth, leather, sequins, fabrics and others). She does all of this to have a better income and to improve the quality of life of her family. She would also like to complete her studies. She promises to repay the loan on time in six monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make handicrafts

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty O. is a hard-working woman. She is forty years of age and resides at Bawalashie with her husband and four children, who are all currently in school. She is a trader who sells provisions such as milk, Milo, sugar, soap, toffees, soft drinks, slippers, plates, and drinking glasses. She operates in a store right in front of her house.

Gifty believes she can make her business grow bigger and brighter. With a loan, she believes that she can purchase more goods in cartons and in bags and meet her customers’ demands. She hopes to help her children continue their education.

loans.use: To buy provisions for her store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, en el sector cuatro, comunidad de Sucano, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 41 años de edad, de estado civil es casada y tiene cinco hijos, asimismo posee estudios de primaria incompleta (segundo de primaria).
Trabaja desde hace cuatro años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio de compra y venta de ganado ovino; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para rescatar mas ganado ovino y comercializarlo en carne y en pie en las ferias ganaderas de Pilcuyo y de Ilave.
Ella piensa mejorar su crianza, por ello requiere asistencia técnica ya que piensa comprar mas ganado (mas ovejas), asimismo quiere dedicarse a comercialización de chuño, papa y oca, es decir comprar al mayor en los mercados de desaguadero y venderlos al menor en los mercados de Tacna y Arequipa, con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles le servirá para lo que viene proyectando, finalmente la ganancias de su negocio lo viene invirtiendo en la educación de sus hijos y el sustento diario; se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of "Las Brisas del Rio Blanco" Communal Bank in sector four of the Sucano community located in the Pilcuyo district of the province of El Collao in the state of Puno. She is 41 years old, married with five children and has an incomplete secondary school education (equivalent of the 8th grade). She has worked for four years with the Manuela Ramos Movement and has a business buying and selling sheep. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase more sheep and she then sold the meat and animals in the markets of Pilcuyo and Ilave. She wants to improve her business and for that she requires technical assistance. She also would like to purchase more sheep and to start selling chuño (dried potatoes used to make soup), potatoes and oca (another type of indigenous potato); in other words, buying at wholesale prices and selling in the markets of Tacna and Arequipa. This loan of 3,000 soles will help with what she has planned and the earnings from her business will be invested in the education and daily care of her children. She promises to repay the loan on time in three monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana B. is a twenty-nine year old woman. She is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. She is a seamstress. She sews all forms of ladies wear of various styles to suit the taste of her customers, like kaba and slit, wedding dresses, and funeral clothes.

Christiana wants to use this loan to buy more fabrics (like linen) and materials (like threads and thimbles) to increase her output and efficiency. She sews dresses and supplies to shops in her community who also sell. She hopes to raise good income to provide her children with quality education. Christiana’s photograph was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Margarita es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Margarita vende frutas en la puerta de su casa. Además margarita junto a su esposo tienen una pequeña ferretería, sus ventas son también a domicilio. Margarita los días sábados y domingos trabaja haciendo limpieza en un hospedaje.
Margarita necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fierros.
Los sueños de Margarita son educar a sus hijos, brindarle todo lo mejor a sus hijos y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Margarita is a partner of Banco Comunal Ollantay (Ollantay Communal Bank). Margarita is 38 years old and has four children. She sells fruit outside her house and owns a small home-delivery hardware store with her husband. Margarita cleans a home on Saturday and Sunday. She needs a 1050 sol loan to invest in the purchase of tools for her store. Her dreams are to educate her children and provide them the best while growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, en el sector cuatro, comunidad D. Sucano, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; D. 40 años D. edad, tiene tres hijos, es casada y posee estudios D. secundaria incompleta (tercero D. secundaria).
Trabaja hace cinco años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos e inicio su negocio D. compra y venta D. ganado, su primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles y se siente contenta porque le permitió comprar ganado ovino para poder engordarlo y venderlo.
Con este préstamo D.  S/. 3000 Nuevos soles, monto que destinará a compra D. mas ganado (ovinos) para poder engordarlos y venderlos en las ferias ganaderas D. Pilcuyo; asimismo ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. quesos; para lo cual requiere el préstamo para poder acopiar mas quesos y venderlos a pedidos en las ferias D. Cusco y Arequipa, D. esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la calidad educativa D. sus hijos; asimismo se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo sus cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Ms. Juliana is a member of the village bank “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, in the fourth sector of the community of Sucano, district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, Department of Puno. She is 40 years old, married, has three children and completed three years of secondary school. For the last five years she has worked with Manuela Ramos and began her business buying and selling cattle. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian Nuevos Soles and she feels content because the loan allowed her to buy sheep to fatten and sell. This loan of 3000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles she will put towards the purchase of more cattle (sheep) to fatten and sell in the cattle markets of Pilcuyo. She also purchases and sells cheese needs this loan in order to acquire more cheeses and sell them by order in the markets of Cusco and Arequipa. In this way she will contribute to the improved education of her children and also punctually pay back her loan in five monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle (sheep) to fatten and sell in the markets of Pilcuyo

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Victoria es casada, tiene 65 años y 4 hijos, Victoria tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende tubérculos, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Victoria tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, su esposo se encarga de la atención.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa, arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Victoria son pagar todas sus deudas, darse unas vacaciones con su esposo, irse de viaje.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Village Bank “Ollantay”. Victoria is 65 years old, married and has four children. Victoria has a stall in the market “12 de Abril” where she sells potatoes and other root crops, an activity which she does every day. Additionally, Victoria has a small store in her home which her husband supervises. Victoria needs a loan of 1050 soles which will be invested in the purchase of potatoes, rice and sugar. Victoria’s dream is to pay off all her debts, giving her a vacation with her husband, and time to travel.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Forgive

texts.en:
Forgive S. is a twenty-five year old single mother with a son in primary school. She lives with her son in a rented apartment. She owns a salon and trades in jeans, lace, and fashion accessories, like weavons, wigs, hair pins, and hair relaxers. She has been in the business for the past four years.

Forgive is very innovative, so a lot of young ladies go to her to have their hair dressed. She buys her materials from the Accra central market. She is requesting a loan to enable her to purchase more items for her beauty shop. She hopes to raise a good income to provide for her son.

loans.use: To procure fashion accessories.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Delia es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Delia viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende ropa variada, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, en la mayoría de las veces son a pedido.
Delia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, ropas interiores.
Los sueños de Delia son tener casa propia, tener un negocio estable y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the community bank Tulipanes. Delia is in a common-law marriage. She is 30 years old and has two children. Delia travels to the Ayacuchana jungle where she sells various clothing. She aquires her products in the city of Lima. Most of the time they are ordered. Delia needs a loan of 1050 soles which she would invest in the purchase of pants and underwear. Delia’s dreams are to have her own home, to have a stable business, and for her children to finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pants and underwear

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, reside en la Av. 19 de Setiembre, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene un hijo, asimismo posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, sed dedica a la compra y venta al mayor de cereales (habas, quinua, chuño) en las ferias de Ilave y Puno; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que destinó a la compra de mas mercadería y su comercialización en la ferias de Ilave y Puno.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles que le servirá como capital para poder adquirir un Molino más y dedicarse al negocio de molido de cereales (habas, quinua, cebada, etc.) asimismo ella piensa mantener su negocio de venta de cereales en las ferias de Ilave y Puno; las ganancias de su negocio lo viene invirtiendo en la educación y alimentación de su menor hijo; agradece a Manuela Ramos por su confianza y apoyo y se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of The White River's Breezes Community Bank. She lives on 19th of September Avenue in Pilcuyo, Peru. She is a 24-year-old mother with one son and lives with her partner. She has a high school degree and has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past three years. She makes a living buying and selling cereals (broad beans, qunioa, potato flour) wholesale at the flea markets in Ilave and Puno. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to purchase more supplies and improve her business in Ilave and Puno. The current loan of 3,000 soles she is requesting will be used to acquire another mill for her cereal business, and her earnings she will used to feed and educate her young son. She thanks Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for its confidence and support, and she promises to repay her loan punctually in five months.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase another mill for her cereal business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy es socia del banco comunal “Las brisas del río blanco” comunidad Chipana, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento de Puno; de  25 años de edad, es casada, no tiene hijo y posee estudios superior completa.
Trabaja hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos e inicio su negocio con una tienda de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería.
Con este préstamo de S/: 2000.00 nuevos soles podrá ampliar su negocio,  ella comprará sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche, y entre otros; de esta manera contribuirá ayudar con los gastos del hogar;  asimismo se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of The White River's Breezes Community Bank in Chipana, Peru. She's 25 years old and married with no children and has a high school degree. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and started her convenience store with her first loan of 300 soles, purchasing supplies. With the loan of 2,000 soles she's requesting, she plans to expand her business, purchasing sacks of rice and sugar, boxes of milk and other items. In this way she will be able to help with household expenses. She promises to repay the loan punctually in five months.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of rice and sugar, boxes of milk and other items for her convenience store

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es:
La señora Ursula es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, de la comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; de  26 años de edad, tiene un  hijo, es conviviente y posee estudios secundaria completa.
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace siete meses e inicio su negocio de abarrotes con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, que invirtió como capital. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 3 cuotas, podrá comprar más mercadería (saco de harina, azúcar, arroz, caja de leche, y entre otros).
texts.en:
Ursula is a member of the Sacuyo Community Bank in Sacuyo, Peru. She is a 26-year-old mother of one son and lives with her partner. She has a high school degree and has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for six months. She started her convenience store with her first loan of 500 soles. With the current loan of 500 soles she's requesting, which she plans to repay in three months, she plans to purchase more merchandise, such as sacks of flour, sugar and rice, boxes of milk and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise, such as sacks of flour, sugar and rice, boxes of milk and other items.

loans.name: Bulgara

texts.en:
Bulgara Z. is a very hardworking woman. She has been in the grain-growing business for approximately 10 years, but she notes that she expanded her business in 2000. She is now seeking to expand her business further based on her experience in the agriculture industry.

She takes great care to ensure that she has a rich harvest each year; more specifically, she explains that her business is successful because she knows what types of seeds to buy and when to plant such seeds. She is hereby requesting a loan through MicroInvest to secure working capital in order to purchase, among other things, seeds and mineral fertilizers. In turn, Bulgara expects to have a plot of land with higher-quality crops and a greater variety of grains.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana A. is thirty-nine years old. She is divorced and has two children. One of her children is in the senior high school and the other in the primary school.

Diana operates a clothing shop in the community market in which she sells ladies blouses, trousers, and fabrics among other items. She buys used textiles in bales from wholesalers. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of ladies clothing in order to raise more income to support her children’s education to the university level. She says it has not been easy for her as a single parent to provide for the children.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” Provincia Juli, Departamento de Puno; de  42 años de edad, conviviente, dos hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace nueve años, dejo dos ciclos luego retomo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio de artesanía; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para comprar materiales como lana de distintos colores, bayetas y otros.
Ella piensa mejorar su negocio de artesanía y quiere también tener negocio de una bodega y restaurante, Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles para comprar al por mayor lana de distintos colores y bayetas y otros materiales, de esta manera obtener mas ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar, finalmente se compromete a pagar puntualmente su  préstamo en seis cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of La Juleñita Community Bank in Juli, Peru. She is a 42-year-old mother of two, lives with her partner and has a high school degree. She has been working with her craft business for nine years and took two off before returning to work with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to purchase materials. She plans to improve her craft business and also wants to start a bodega and restaurant business. With the loan of 1,000 soles she's requesting, she plans to purchase at wholesale wool of distinct colors, baize and other items. In this way she will earn more income and improve the quality of life for household. She plans to repay the loan punctually in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase at wholesale wool of distinct colors, baize and other items

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Flora es separada, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, Flora vende sandalias al por mayor, sus productos los adquiere de las fabricas de la ciudad de Lima, sus ventas los realiza repartiendo al por mayor a las tiendas y puestos de mercado. Además Flora tiene un carro que realiza transporte a la selva ayacuchana.
Flora necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sandalias.
Los sueños de Flora son tener casa propia, tener una tienda estable.
texts.en:
Flora is a member of the Tulipanes Community Bank.

Flora is separated, she is 32 years old and she has a son. Flora sells sandals in a wholesale capacity, she acquires her products in the warehouses in the city of Lima. The sales she carries out primarily by distributing to stores and stands in the market.

She also owns a car that is used to for transportation to the Ayacuchana forest.

Flora needs a loan of 1800 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of sandals.

Flora's dreams are to own her own home, and have an established store.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sandals.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth F. is a hard-working woman who resides at Legon, a suburb of Accra. She lives with her husband and two kids.

Elizabeth operates a cold store within the vicinity of her home. She sells assorted fish, like salmon and red fish, as well as chicken, beef, turkey, and other meat. She buys her stock from big cold stores in Tema but due to inadequate working capital, she is not able to procure enough stock. She is therefore requesting a loan to increase her stock and meet her customer demands. She hopes to help her husband put up their own structure.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish and meat to sell.

loans.name: Yadiza Yelka

texts.es:
Yadiza es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Yadiza es conviviente, tiene 20 años y 1 hijo, Yadiza vende cosméticos por catálogos de diferentes líneas como ebel, avon, sus ventas son al crédito. Además Yadiza vende ropa que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. También Yadiza trabaja por las mañanas como secretaria en una institución.
Yadiza necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, polos, casacas.
Los sueños de Yadiza son comprar carros para alquilar, abrir una tienda de ropa o abarrotes.
texts.en:
Yadiza is a member of Tulipanes Community Bank.

Yadiza is common law married, she is 20 years old and has a son. Yadiza sells cosmetics by different catalogues such as Ebel and Avon, completing her sales through a credit system. Yadiza sells clothing that she acquires in the city of Lima. Yadiza also works in the mornings as a secretary for a company.

Yadiza require a loan of 1500 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of pants, polo shirts, and jackets.

Yadiza's dreams are to purchase a fleet of rental cars, and to open a store to sell clothing or groceries.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pants, polo shirts, and jackets.

loans.name: Inés Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, en el sector cuatro, comunidad de Sucano, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 21 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene un hijo, asimismo posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace dos años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio de compra y venta al mayor de cereales (habas, quinua, chuño) en las ferias de Arequipa y crianza de cerdos; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que destinó a la comercialización de sus productos en la feria de El Altiplano en Arequipa.
Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles que le servirá como capital adicional en la compra de más mercadería (chuño al mayor) para comercializarlo al mayor y menor en los mercados de Tacna y Arequipa; asimismo comprar cerdos para engordarlos y las ganancias de su negocio lo viene invirtiendo en la alimentación de su menor hijo y para su posterior educación; agradece a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo y se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Verónica is a member of The White River's Breezes Community Bank and lives in Sucano, Peru. She is a 21-year-old married mother of one son and has a high school degree. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for two years. She has a business buying and selling cereals (broad beans, quinoa, potato flour) at the Arequipa flea market and also raises pigs. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to sell her products at the Altiplano market in Arequipa. With the current loan of 800 soles she's requesting, she plans to purchase more merchandise (potato flour at wholesale) to sell at wholesale and retail at the markets in Tacna and Arequipa. She will also purchase pigs to fatten, and will use the earnings to feed and later educat her children. She thanks Manuela Ramos for its support and she promises to repay the loan punctually in five months.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potato flour at wholesale to sell at wholesale and retail at the markets in Tacna and Arequipa, and purchase pigs to fatten

loans.name: Emma Rita

texts.es:
Enma es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Enma es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Enma viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, que luego de acopiar los procesa en un molino alquilado, elabora harinas, cereales partidos y los vende a las diferentes instituciones y también en los mercados.
Enma necesita un préstamo de 2550 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada, haba.
Enma sueña con tener su propias maquinas procesadoras, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos en colegios particulares.
texts.en:
Emma is a member of the Tulipanes Community Bank.

Emma is married common-law, she is 37 years old and she has 2 children. Enma travels to the different town fairs in the region where she purchases cereals, that soon after she acquires them she grinds them in a rented mill, producing flours and crushed cereals. She then sells them to different companies and in the markets.

Emma requires a loan in the amount of 2550 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchse of wheat, grains, and fava beans.

Emma dreams of having her own processing equipment, as well as providing her children with an education in private schools.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wheat, grains, and fava beans.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen F. is thirty-two years old. She is married with one child, who is currently in school. She is a serious-minded business woman who works hard to support her husband to provide for her family. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a suburb of Accra, the capital city.

Helen owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, and skimmed powdered milk. She deems it an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, and other items to increase her stock of goods available for sale. It is Helen’s dream to make enough savings to help her husband put up their own building.

loans.use: To procure stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, en el sector cuatro, comunidad de Sucano, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene cinco hijos, asimismo posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace cuatro años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio de engorde de ganado ovino y venta de cereales (chuño, quinua, cebada etc.); su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, que los destinó a la compra de mercadería para venta en las ferias dominicales de Pilcuyo y de Ilave.
Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles podra adquirir ovinos para engorde y comprar mas mercadería al mayor (habas, chuño, quinua, cebada, etc.), finalmente la ganancias de su negocio lo viene invirtiendo en la educación de sus hijos y el sustento diario y se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the White River's Breezes Community Bank in Sucano, Peru. She is a 48-year-old married mother of five children and has an elementary school education. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for four years. She has a business fattening sheep and selling cereals (potato flour, quinoa, barley, etc.). Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to purchase merchandise to sell at Sunday markets in Pilcuyo and Ilave. With the current loan of 500 soles she's requesting, she plans to acquire sheep to fatten and purchase more merchandise at wholesale (broad beans, potato flour, quinoa, barley, etc.). She'll use the earnings from her businesses for her children's education and daily sustenance. She promises to repay the loan punctually in five months.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire sheep to fatten and purchase more merchandise at wholesale (broad beans, potato flour, quinoa, barley, etc.)

loans.name: Elizabeth Rosbelly

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Elizabeth es soltera, tiene 26 años y vive con sus padres, Elizabeth tiene cabinas de Internet, que esta ubicado en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, además vende accesorios de celulares, servicio de locutorio, fotocopias, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 1 personal.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de accesorios de computadora.
Elizabeth sueña con tener una tienda de accesorios de computadoras y tener otra sucursal.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Tulipanes Community Bank.

Elizabeth is single, she is 26 years old and she lives with her parents. Elizabeth owns internet booths located on a main street in the city of Ayacucho, and in addition she sells cellphone accessories, provides telephone and photocopy services, a business she has been running with the help of one employee.

Elizabeth requires a loan in the amount of 2100 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of computer accessories.

Elizabeth dreams of having a store to sell computer accessories, and to have a second location.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase computer accessories.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Maria es casada, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Maria vende cosméticos por catálogos de diferentes líneas como Avon, esika, sus productos los ofrece a amigos y familiares en sus tiempos libres, sus ventas son en mayor parte al crédito.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de perfumes, cremas.
Los sueños de Maria son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un local estable para su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Tulipanes Community Bank.

Maria is married, she is 37 years old and she has 2 children. Maria sells cosmetics through catalogues such as Avon and Esika. She sells her products to friends and family in her spare time. She completes the majority of her sales on a credit system.

Maria requires a loan in the amount of 1050 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of perfumes and creams.

Maria's dream is to see her children grow up to be professionals, and to have an established store for her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba M. is a 52 year old local restaurant operator. She is divorced and has seven children. At the moment Abiba is taking care of two children who are in school, as the rest are independent. Abiba lives at Abofour, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region. She has lived there since she started her restaurant. Abiba divorced her husband when he refused to take care of his responsibilities.

Abiba prepares and sells local foods like Deihuo or what we popularly called Tuozafi (TZ). TZ is prepared from milled maize and powdered cassava. This food is known among the Muslim community in every part of Ghana. It has been embraced and accepted by many Ghanaians because of the taste and its delicacy. With her tasty meals, Abiba has attracted lots of customers in the area where she served. Therefore it has become necessary to employ additional hands to assist her in food delivering service. TZ is enjoyed with green leaves soup with meat and fish.

Abiba says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditures. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like baskets of cassava, maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance. Abiba belongs to a village bank called Fear Not. She also hope to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora A. is a 39-year-old woman who resides in Abeka Lapaz, a suburb of Accra, with her husband and 5 children. They live in a rented apartment. Currently, 4 of her children are in school. The last born is yet to start school. Dora owns and operates a cosmetics and fabrics shop in the local market. She believes she can make her business grow bigger and brighter with loan support and wants to use the loan to buy more assorted cosmetics to increase her stock of goods. Dora’s photograph was taken during her group meeting. She says she wants to work harder to support her children in school.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and fabrics

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
La señora Rosalía es socia del banco comunal “Las brisas del río blanco” comunidad Chipana, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento D. Puno; D.  40 años D. edad, estado civil casada, con nueve hijos y solo estudio hasta primero D. primaria.
Trabaja hace 3 años  y seis meses con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en la compra y venta D. ovejas, toro y  cerdos  para engorD..
Con este préstamo S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles para poder comprar más animales (toros, cerdos y ovejas); D. esta manera contribuirá ayudar con los gastos D. su hogar, brindado ayuda en la educación D. sus hijos, finalmente  se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a member of "Las Brisas del Río Blanco" Communal Bank in the community of Chipana located in the Pilcuyo district of the province of Collao in the state of Puno. She is 40 years old, married with nine children and has a 1st graD. education. She has worked for three years and six months with the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her first loan of 300 soles was invested in purchasing and selling sheep, a bull and pigs. With this loan of 3,000 soles she will be able to purchase more animals (bulls, pigs and sheep) and will therefore contribute to help with household expenses and give her children an education. She promises to repay the loan on time in five monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: For the past 8 years, Lucy has been trading in the local market of Haatso in Ghana. She is a 38-year-old woman and is married with 3 children who are in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment. She is a busy petty trader who sells cassava, plantains, smoked fish, and yams. Lucy buys her stock from the Accra central market, but due to her limited income, she is not able to purchase more stock. She is convinced that her business can grow with increased capital. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of yams, plantains, cassava, and fish. Lucy hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children’s education.

loans.use: To procure foodstuffs

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Dionisia es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Dionisia es casada, tiene 52 años y 2 hijos, Dionisia tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende zapatos variados, además algunos días viaja a las diferentes ferias en donde también vende zapatos.
Dionisia necesita un préstamo de 3600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos y zapatillas.
Los sueños de Dionisia son que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales y aumentar su negocio con mas variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Dionisia is a member of the Tulipanes Community Bank.

Dionisia is married, she is 52 years old and she has 2 children. Dionisia has stand in the market «12 de Abril» where she sells various styles of shoes, and some days she travels to the different town faires where she also sells shoes.

Dionisia requires a loan in the amount of 3600 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of shoes and pumps.

Dionisia's dream is to see her children as accomplished professionals and to expand her business to have greater selection.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes and pumps.

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en:
Zenabu Adama is 30 years old. She is married and the mother of 4 kids. Currently all her kids are in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her daily source of livelihood. She has been a food vendor for 5 years now, a business through which she makes income to support her family. She sells fante kenkey, which is one of the favorite foods enjoyed by many Ghanaians because it supplies carbohydrate components in diets. Fante kenkey is prepared from milled maize and is eaten with either stew or soup, and it can also be mashed for ice kenkey.

Zenabu takes delivery of stock from farmers who provide her with direct supplies of maize. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy maize in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. Zenabu belongs to a village bank called Isaac. She also hopes to receive GH500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her home.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, reside en el Barrio Chipana, Av. 19 de Setiembre, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene cinco hijos, asimismo posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, se dedica en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que destinó a la compra de mas mercadería para su tienda.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles le servirá como capital adicional para poder completar la mercadería en su tienda, es decir comprar bebidas, arroz en saco, azúcar, enlatados, etc.; los ingresos surgidos de su negocio lo viene invirtiendo en la educación superior de uno de sus hijos y el sustento familiar diario; agradece a Manuela Ramos por su confianza y apoyo y se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of "Las Brisas del Río Blanco" Communal Bank. She lives on Avenida 19 de Septiembre in the Chipana neighborhood, located in the Pilcuyo district of El Collao province in the state of Puno. She is 47 years old, married with five children and has a 6th grade education. She has worked for three years with the Manuela Ramos Movement and has a general store. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy merchandise for her store. This loan of 3,000 soles will serve as additional capital to be used to purchase more merchandise for the store; in other words to buy soft drinks, bags of rice, sugar, canned goods, etc. The income generated from the business is invested in the higher education of one of her children and used to pay her family's daily expenses. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for their trust and support. She promises to repay the loan on time in five monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for a general store

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce L. is 30 years old. She is married with 2 children. She resides in Haatso with her family. She is a food vendor and sells fufu and banku. Fufu is prepared from cassava and plantain, cooked and pounded together, and eaten with different kinds of soup. It is a very popular traditional food among the Ashanti tribe of the Ghanaian society. It is enjoyed either as breakfast, lunch, or supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to raise increased income to open a restaurant and help her children in school.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs
